Reviews.Title: “Best best best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Younes J
Reviews.Content: We are now in our hometown with great sweet memories of the Istanbul and its Emine Sultan hotel. Excellent location (calm with beautiful view of the Marmara sea), very clean and sweet rooms, excellent staff (they are very friendly and very nice) and delicious breakfast. Just take the hotel location map from the hotel website and do not rely on google map!! You will be in a friendly hotel, near to almost all of historical scenic areas of the Istanbul and will enjoy delicious breakfasts of the Emine Sultan hotel while taking deep looks at flying seagulls and ships crossing through the Bosphorus strait and Marmara sea. By the way, the hotel staff are very nice and you can get good helpful guides about transfers, foods and historical places of the Istanbul from them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loukia L
Reviews.Content: Thank you Ozen for the 5 wonderful days. I had great vacations !! Great service at the beauty full hotel and very helpful with the sightseeings. Very close to the blue mosque and easy to go arround and have a good time. Nice food and excellent hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy place with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DanielJanine
Reviews.Content: The Hotel consists of two houses - one for the "Hotel" and the other one for the "Suites". We stayed for one week at Emine Sultan Hotel, so we can only refer to this part. It is situated in a rather quiet street just 5 minutes by foot from the Hippodrom/Blue Mosque. They arranged bustransfer from and to the airport as well as a Bosporus boattrip, which we heartly enjoyed and specially recommend. The rooms are clean and neat in ottoman style. Our room had a magnificent view over the Marmara Sea to the asian districts of the city. The room itself was equipped with a double bed and was in good condition; the bathroom had seen some time but was clean and comfy. Only minor shortcomming was the tripping noise from the stairway and the level above, due to the sultanahmed type construction of the building. But as the hotel features only 10 rooms there was not that much traffic and therefore you can get along with that. The breakfast room also features a 180Â° view of marmara sea and part of the busporus as well as the blue mosque. Breakfast buffet is of turkish style (Cheese, BÃ¶rek, Wineleafes and fresh cakes etc.) and delicious. Most of the food is homemade by a especially friendly and polite lady, who also serves the breakfast. After breakfast time tea is provided in the breakfast room for the rest of the day. There's a terrace at the rooftop which is also a nice place to relax. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpfull. The whole hotel features a cosy atmosphere and the staff is eager to make you feel at home. We enjoyed our stay very much and recommend emine sultan hotel for your visit as there's hardly anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful destination”
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a fantastic trip to Istanbul! The location of the hotel was perfect for walking visits to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the archeological museum, and so much more. Public transportation was also nearby for trips outside of walking distance. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. I was concerned about safety having never traveled to Istanbul, but felt very safe at the Emine Sultan. Andrea L., USA

Reviews.Title: “go and see beatefull pleace,you will have fun”
Reviews.Author: nufel c
Reviews.Content: A royal vacation for my wife and I.Only have one word to describe: excellent.We will always remember how well we were treated in all ways.Excellent management. The day of our departure we also thing that near by old peninsula great locations

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Sultan? then stay at Emine Sultan !”
Reviews.Author: AkgÃ¼n A
Reviews.Content: With the location and being so close to all historical sights of beautiful city Istanbul Emine Sultan Hotel offers a great deal with pricing and vacancy. I was pampered by the service. The staff was pretty friendly, my room was well organized and awesomely decorated. I enjoyed every minute of my stay there. I definitely, highly, extremely recommend Emine Sultan Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for new year 2011”
Reviews.Author: erhan a
Reviews.Content: l live in greece and in 2011 l wanted to visit istanbul turkey for new year the choice l made for hotel was the best eminesultan so nice view clean kind definatly from now on its my only choice my best wishes for new year 2012 thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: “How lucky I was to pick Emine Sultan Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GillLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: At the end of my Turkey trip, I returned to Istanbul and chose to stay in Emine Sultan Hotel after seeing all positive comments. It was proved that my choice was 100% correct! The hotel is really small with only 10 rooms, accommodating 20 guests! My room is 401, which is the only room on the 4th floor (the breakfast room also locates on 4/F). It is a double room with excellent views of Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque! I especially love the adorable bedding and extremely strong shower. Though the room is small, it has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Free wifi and a guest computer is available too. The breakfast room is large, offers wide range of choice and delicious food, and with wonderful view of Marmara Sea! It is definitely enjoyable to have a good, filling breakfast here before a day of busy sightseeing in Istanbul! The staff is very nice, helpful and you can feel they serve by heart. The counter staff was friendly but he would not keep talking to you (I like more personal space). The breakfast room lady was eager to make sure I had and I enjoyed the breakfast! haha she's really a lovely lady! I cannot recommend Emine Sultan Hotel highly enough! I wished I could stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexander C
Reviews.Content: Booked in the Emine Sultan last minute to ease a bad flight connection after seeing the positive reviews. More than met expectations. Friendly staff, clean rooms with character and a wonderful surprise view from the breakfast room of the sea and the Blue Mosque. Great location with all the site within easy walking distance. Plan to go back with the family.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience with lovely and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Muhdfahd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are on holiday and had some problem finding a hotel in Istanbul. Finally, got to knw one of the staff at emine sultan and they gave me very good rate for the room. As a matter of fact, they even upgrade us to the suite on our last night. Lovely lovely hotel. Special thanks to oozy, burhan and Susan from emine sultan and special thanks to ausie from Aussie travel for their kind help.. With love from Fahd and Rahmah - Singapore

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis F
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul and part of the reason was this delightful hotel. Small and sweet. The staff were terrific. Very helpful. Great suggestions for restaurants and place to visit. Breakfast was great. Room was clean. Location is fantastic. A short walk to the Blue Mosque and great reastaurants and shops. We spent 3 nights there and could not have been more pleased. View from the breakfast lounge was great and it is open all day for tea.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MumfromSurrey
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a 4 year old to Istanbul for 4 days and stayed at the Emine Sultan Suites (which is a 5 min walk from the main hotel). Worked out better for us as the rooms were bigger and much more spacious and perfect for families. Location is fantastic as it's in a quiet street, yet the restauarants, tourish attractions etc are literally a few minutes away. Staff are friendly and helpful and really do treat you well. Breakfast is much nicer at the main hotel (you can eat at either place) ... the breakfast room has lovely views of the Blue Mosque and the sea. The breakfast spread is more than adequate and they were happy to cater to our child's needs. We had a great stay and would recommend this to anyone looking to stay in Sultanahmet district.

Reviews.Title: “"Ideal location, Welcoming Staff"”
Reviews.Author: Kat D
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly by the staff and welcomed with a cup of apple tea in the beautiful breakfast room which overlooks the sea. Our room was clean and comfortable also with a great view of the sea. While the hotel is located very close to the Mosque and most of the main attractions it is situated in a local neighborhood which we really enjoyed. The hotel's owner graciously gave us a delicious bottle of Turkish wine---the wines made in Turkey are suberb do try them! We enjoyed chatting with the staff who shared many insider tips as well as some insight into the Turkish culture and people. Our evening strolls after a wonderful dinner at any one of a number of restaurants in the area will always be remembered. We would definitely return---it would seem like we were going home! Thanks to all for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nah79
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Always spotlessly clean, friendly and very helpful staff (not at all pushy as mentioned in the review below), the owner is a friendly and chatty young woman who is keen to make sure everyone staying is happy. The location is excellent - close to the nice (touristy in a good way) bars and restaurants of Sultanahmet, and a very short wall to the Blue Mosque and everything else. Great view from our room and the terrace. Breakfast buffet was an excellent choice of a range of Turkish food, cereals, bread jam, juice, teas, coffee, Turkish coffee... which they would happily replace if things ran out. A great stay in a lovely hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Sharyn M
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel was like a home away from home on a very busy 2 week trip of Turkey. The staff are unassuming and incredibly warm. The rooms, while small, are clean, comfortable and homely. The position is fantastic - walk to most main sites and the rail & tram service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not the panacea described on trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: Beeblebrot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Emine Sultan Suites for 8 nights recently and felt motivated to write a slightly more balanced review given that the bulk of those on Trip Advisor seem rather enthusiastic. The Suites is a small (4 room) sister hotel to the main Emine Sultan located at what seemed like the edge of the tourist district. It is not a hotel as such but more a small guest house. We stayed in the top floor room which was lovely with a balcony facing the sea and a Jacuzzi in the room which was a great surprise. The room was clean and well serviced with a fridge, air conditioning, large flat screen TV, good shower and even a hairdryer which was useful. What I would say to balance this is however is that the service was not good. A few things to mention; there was a small Hamam and Sauna in the hotel which was never introduced so we never had the chance to use it. The breakfast service was variable and seemed to struggle in particular when all the rooms were full, the food on offer was tasty if slightly repetitive, but coffee often short and more not forthcoming. The hotel was also locked up when we came home one day which was disappointing. Most importantly however the hostess was very pushy about organised events in particular a boat trip and some sort of Turkish dancing night the former very overpriced and the later of no interest to us. These events were mentioned repeatedly for the first four days of the trip (to the point where we were dreading it) and when it became clear that we were not going to be taking up either offer service took a nose dive. This culminated in a very bad atmosphere particularly when it came to settling up and leaving. We had to walk up the road to use the credit card facility in another building which is not out of the ordinary but was clearly highly inconvenient for our host. Iâ€™m afraid this left me with a bad taste after out most enjoyable stay in Istanbul. All in all itâ€™s a lovely little guest house but maybe its best to go on the 25 Euro boat trip it might work out better for you this way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: comcox
Reviews.Content: We were booked for two nights at Emine Sultan Hotel at the end of our trip to Turkey. As our shuttle van wound it's way into the tiny streets off the highway from the airport our first night, I wondered where exactly we were going. There were just a few small hotels, a couple of private dwellings and lots of quiet so I wondered how far away from things we were. However, the light of the next day and a very short walk brought me right to the famed Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, and Hagia Sophia--you couldn't imagine a more perfect location. From our second floor window (Room 203) we could look out on the ships passing through the Bosphorus. The room with two twin beds was snug and since my main chore for this stay was to reorganize all our suitcases before flying home it was a tight space. But there was a nice homey feel to the room. On the rooftop is a terrace where breakfast is served--a buffet with a fairly good selection of items including cocoa (a first on our whole trip). The lobby is quite elegant and includes a computer for free guest use. There is an elevator but it's one person plus one suitcase size so it took us more than one trip. The staff are quite wonderful and speak excellent English. When our shuttle van to the airport did not show up as scheduled on departure morning, the desk man called around to find us alternate transportation and said he would pay the driver and then bill our tour company himself. A block away is a main street that has cafes and shops. A great place to eat is the cafe attached to the Abella Hotel which offers meals throughout the day. I especially recommend their tomato soup which comes with a large backet of fresh bread.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: TheExplorerLondon
Reviews.Content: Location - The hotel is conveniently located, very close to the top attractions and also to dozens of good eat outs and local shops Staff - Excellent! Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The owner - Ã–zen and her colleagues - Suzan and Selim, helped us with advice on what to see, where to eat in the city and also with bookings for the Whirling Dervishes shows Breakfast - Decent spread. Nice and tasty Rooms - Spacious, neat and clean. Lots of storage space Price - Maybe a wee bit pricey given that the peak of the tourist season was already well over

Reviews.Title: “You are treated like family.”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel28970
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely everything I hoped it would be and more. The location was absolutely perfect....a 10 minute walk through the heart of the city to get to the subway, a five minute walk to some of the cities biggest attractions, near several yummy food venues, surrounded by great local shops, and very safe. The hotel was also clean and provided everything you could possibly need- wireless internet, a delicious breakast, in room fridges, and various tour group offerings. However, my favorite part about the hotel was the service. We were treated like family while at the Emine Sultan Hotel. ALL of the staff went way, way out of their way to take care of us. Whatever we needed, at any time, all we had to do was ask. We were hungry one late night...so they opened up their kitchen for us at 3am. I needed tape and boxes to ship some of the goodies I bought home...the next day I had boxes and tap waititng outside of my hotel room door. My friend and I also wanted to check out some local hooka venues....the owner and his friend personally took us out one night. By the end of the trip I most sad to have to say goodbye to the wonderful staff. I look forward to seeing them all again. You would be a fool to oay more and stay anywhere else. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “We hope to come back next year at the same hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svetlanabah
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic - great decor and very clean, Great sauna and turkish bath.. The staff were very helpful. In particular Suzan . She helped us with advises what to see in the city and which restaurants to chose for dinner. We hope to stay in the same hotel during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Yes! We loved it and plan to be back”
Reviews.Author: ssalessi
Reviews.Content: Perfect location inthe Sultanahmed old part of Istanbul. The view of the Blue Mosque from the patio on the top is breath taking, specially at night. You have breakfast looking at the Marmara Sea and everything is home made including the many kinds of mermelaids. The lady who prepares all is sweet and helpful and always available. it is a rather small hotel and it does not have a restaurant, but it is surrounded by places where to eat. The rooms are not big but quite adequate. The guys at the front are very friendly and helpful. We have nothing negative to report! Within walking distance from all, including a beautiful open air Bazar that used to be horse stables. We fell inlove with the area and were very happy at The Emine Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Amizing Trip Ä°n Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Emine Sultan hotel with one of my friend hotel is reallt close Blue mosque, Hagia sofia, Topkapi place and old historical area of Ä°stanbul. Hotel nice and clean, the staf were friendly and helpful. .And istanbul is amazing town of the Euro; you can enjoy every munite in istanbul you can visit museum join the day art museum, arkelojical museum etc Grand bazaar , Spice bazaar ) and you can have really fun at night round Taksim and BeÅŸiktaÅŸ ( asmali mescit , reina, Nevizade ) ... Ä° really highly recomend Emine Sultan Hotel an Ä°stanbul, We will stay again our next trip in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Antmango
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the suites. The room was fantastic - balcony, spa, great decor and very clean. The staff were very helpful. In particular Suzan even lent us her own umbrella and helped us in organizing many details of our onward travel.

Reviews.Title: “We were in love with place!!!:))”
Reviews.Author: BellaCanada76
Reviews.Content: The greatest location..the finest hospitality...the most generous management..so whats more!! would we looking for???.which was a great experience..we felt like home...The nicest view from the roof bar and cute breakfast area with sharing other guests...We already suggested to family and friends..we are definitely planing to going back there..My favorite guys are Hakan and Oguz...take care of yourself guys!!..many regards from North America....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff in great area”
Reviews.Author: KarimMasarweh
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 2 years old daughter and myself stayed in a triple room for 6 nights at this very nice hotel. It is located at Sultanahmet which is the perfect spot to start your journeys to the main tourist attractions of Istanbul. Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya is a 10 minutes walk from hotel. Next to them is the Hippodrome where anight activities like concerts are frequently held. Next to Aya Sofya there is a tram station that can take you easily to all other interesting place (like Dolmabahce Palace, Kabatas from which you can take the ferry to Princes' Islands etc). Topkapi Palace is also at walking distance. The hotel staff are so polite and friendly. This is a small hotel including about 10 rooms, so the feeling is like being in a family rather than in a business hotel, which further enhances the experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Oguz, Kiokhan and everyone: THANK YOU! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: onowhereman
Reviews.Content: An old 5 story family residence nicely remodeled with cozy rooms and a sunny breakfast terrace looking out over the rooftops to the Bosporus and the Sea of Marmara. Friendly, helpful staff were very accommodating, and airport transit arrangements were efficient and easy. Rooms are small, but comfortable enough, with modern fixtures and a little room to move around. A small fridge is provided, helpful on those hot summer days. Wireless internet access was pretty good, although my standards are low since we live in Nairobi. It's a nice start to the day, stepping out the door into a quiet neighborhood that was once very local, but is now converting rapidly to B&Bs. Access by taxi is a bit problematic, it's best to be prepared to walk a bit, since the roads immediately around the hotel are crowded and narrow. The tram line is a good way to get around. It's only a ten minute walk up to the Hippodrome, where you can catch the train The hotel is within walking distance of all the main sights in Sultanahmet, in You get a nice view of the domes of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop terrace. Hagia Sophia is just beyond the mosque, the old cistern is nearby, and Topkapi is very close, too. There are also a number of good restaurants nearby, and the Istanbul Handicrafts Center, across the street from Dervis Cafe, just between the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, is a good place for quality ceramics and price reference points for the bazaar. It is possible to walk across the Galata Bridge up to the Galata Tower in about an hour, quite a nice walk, actually. The views from the tower are great, as they should be, since it was built as a fire watchtower in the 6th century. In short, good location, friendly, helpful staff, comfortable rooms, pleasant place for breakfast, and a nice, local feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient - perfect base for an Istanbul adventure !”
Reviews.Author: SmithsMarlborough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Emine Sultan on recommendation of friends and we were delighted with the choice we made. All the staff carefully trained by owner Ozen were warm and friendly and made every effort to ensure our stay was enjoyable and fun. We even learned some Turkish thanks to daily lessons in reception - Mutluyum !!

Reviews.Title: “'Highly recommended'”
Reviews.Author: jesselene
Reviews.Content: Older solo experienced traveller with some mobility difficulties found the Emine Sultan Hotel to be excellent for comfort and service, with lift access to all floors. Rooms were well appointed, air conditioned, and comfortable. Breakfast served surrounded by views over rooftops to Sultanahmet and the Marmara Sea. Staff always available to help and advise. Situated within walking distance of Blue Mosque, Haighia Sophia, and Arasta Bazaar, with a variety of small shops and restaurants. This hotel comes with the highest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “this will be my home from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: risal
Reviews.Content: the most delightful small hotel in an ideal position. I was given the only room on the 4th floor, by the breakfast terrace, and had a wonderful view of the Sultan Ahmet mosque and the Sea of Marmara. Loved being woken by the call to prayer. The location is close enough to the touristy sights (Sultan Ahmed Mosque, Aya Sofya and much more) that one can get there before most of the crowds, and within walking distance of many other "must sees". The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet, though good, can't quite compete with "grander" hotels such as the Eresin Crown (where I've also stayed) but in every other regard the Emine Sultan beats it hands down, at least for a solo female traveller like myself. Strongly recommended for all who prefer a small, friendly hotel to an impersonal "international bland" one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it I will be back some day.”
Reviews.Author: bashaml
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights and could not recommend it highly enough. The staff are very friendly, the accommodation is more boutique style as apposed to your standard and well worth it. The rooms are amazing, everything is within walking distance and the service is outstanding. You will not be disappointed. Leanne Australia.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful 4 day stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ocey
Reviews.Content: I had the most enjoying stay in this hotel. It was clean and very close to the blue mosque and topkapi palace. The staff was very kind, especially dear Ozen & Gurur we had nice friendship. I did not planned much with their advices I just had a wonderful holiday. I will come and stay again. I am lookin forward for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation, will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: BJ2Travellers
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located in Sultanahmet, walking distance to the "must see" sights of Istanbul. Rooms very well appointed, extremely comfortable and tastefully decorated. Impressed with the cleanliness and impeccable service. Staff very friendly, polite and willing to help. Fantastic views from the rooftop dining room and all the meals were beautifully presented.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lachie255060
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in May. Very central location surrounded by similar small hotels and wooden houses. Only ten rooms in the hotel. Room was small but fitted out delightfully and there was a bottle of red wine and two glasses as a welcome gift. Breakfast is served in sunny room with view of the harbour and there is a small rooftop terrace with more views. Plenty of restaurants nearby. We had to leave early in the morning, before breakfast, and the staff provided us with lovely fresh salad rolls as we left. Free wi-fi. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You simply will not find better!”
Reviews.Author: emort
Reviews.Content: I have already written a glowing report about Emine, having stayed there 5 times as a solo traveller, but this time as part owner of a small Tour Company, we stayed there with our 10 guests for 5 nights . Emine was our choice to set exactly the right tone for our wonderful 19day Tour of Turkey. Everyone felt very much at home, loved their rooms, the cleanliness ,the breakfasts, the views, and especially the courtesy and efficiency of Ozen and her staff who handled every request with warmth and professionalism. The excellent location gives easy access to the most beautiful sites, while providing the peace and quiet of a small side street. You simply will not find better!

Reviews.Title: “Small, intimate hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ELIvanko
Reviews.Content: We picked Emine Sultan hotel from the web. Read plenty of reviews.... and we were right! Conveniently located to all tourist attractions, literally in walking distance. The staff very very pleasant, ready to serve you. Breakfast wonderfull, smaller selection than in big hotels (who need it, anayway...), but the quality of food was just perfect. I can not forget the smile of the lady who assisted during breakfast. Honest, radiant, wonderful! The rooms were a bit small, but clean, very comfortable, beds excellent. And off course, the terrace with views to die for.... All in all, thumbs up for Emine Sultan in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BouH
Reviews.Content: I've been there two times - in Feb 2009 and June 2010. The hotel has about 10 rooms. Rooms are a little bit small but very cozy. You'll have a great breakfast with a nice view to the sea (but you should know that closer to the end of the breakfast time everything will be cold or over). Hotel has super terrace on the roof with tables and chairs with a great view of Blue Mosque. I'm sure I'll advice this hotel to my friends although it's a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: eileenca_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location - in the old city, but not in a noisy area. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and breakfast is good. We used their airport pickup service. In all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel, right in the centre of the old town”
Reviews.Author: Sennokians
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Emine Sultan and couldn't fault it for comfort, value for money, service, and friendliness of the staff. Great view of the Bosphorous from the breakfast room. Also check out their in-house city tours ..Aussie Travel..great trips with very informative guides.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul, and we stayed at the Emine Sultan for three nights. The location is perfect for a first trip as it's close to everything we wanted to see - Blue Mosque, Topkopki Palace, etc. - and a short walk to the tram. (Do try the tram from Sultanhamet as it runs frequently, is clean and inexpensive and stops at all of the important locations.) We found the hotel staff to be gracious and very helpful. Bella and Ozzie at the front desk were delightful. The breakfast buffet included homemade goodies prepared by two lovely women as well as other items. One of the nicest features of the hotel is that they left the breakfast room area open all day, so you could use it as a lounge. That was especially nice because the sleeping rooms are rather small. They are, however, clean and pleasantly appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for the Old town (Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: SzakiHun01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Istanbul with 2 friends and spent the nights in the Hotel. I can recommend it for anyone, who wants a close and clean hotel for its walking tours near the Blue Mosque. Everything is so close we saved huge money on transportation! Hotel is clean, staff is friendly - expect full 3star service. Take into account the muezzins early in the mornings - you are so close to the mosque you here it every time, unless you party out and sleep as a dog as we did. The view on the Sea and the harbour is stunning and you can enjoy it from the rooms or the breakfast terrace. Definitely a good value and impeccable serviced hotel for a 3 star rating. One thing about staff: we received personalized and detailed tourist guidance with the booking confirmation that was very helpful indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Oriental, turkish Optimum in Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: todt
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is relatively small, with a beautiful outlook on the Bosporus. Together with the cleanness of the rooms, the warm colours of the interieur and simple but tasteful furniture, the hotel is breathing the atmosphere of intimacy. To have a place of retreat und relaxation like this, is important in such a large city of Istanbul. This is underlined by the very friendly and helpful staff of the hotel and the small team in the reception. They give you always the feeling that you and your wishes are welcomed. They do their very best to make them real. So it is not overdone to say, that the Emine Sultan Hotel stands for an more than acceptable relation of prize and what you get -with its good and tasty breakfast, its central localisation in the old part of the town and the outlook on to the sea, but also with the proverbly oriental hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danbaker001
Reviews.Content: Service was perfect! 24 hour front desk (spoke very good english) who were happy to help with any queries I had about Istanbul & Turkey. I arrived just before midnight (late flight) and the front door was open and the hotel reception welcoming. My room was immaculate, and a nice view of the water from the balcony. Fresh sheets and a well kept bathroom, and the room also came with a complimentary bottle of red! Satellite television (english channels) was a plus. Great location, short walk to the Blue Mosque/Town centre. Also close to the busier nightlife area of town, which was good for a solo traveller. Breakfast was the best I had in the various places in Turkey I stayed during my trip! Would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect quiet haven in the cacophony of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wellgrove
Reviews.Content: A very small hotel that gave us a very warm welcome - and has a perfect location and the most marvellous view of the Marmari Sea. The breakfast room on the top floor serves as everybody's cozy living room throughout the day and evening ( - a perfect idea!) and the incredibly helpful and smiling staff are ready to assist at any time apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitcham07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find as it was reasonably priced and in a great location, there is a great view of the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque from the breakfast area. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and about a 20 min walk to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. The staff are so friendly and helpful with great advise on where to go and eat in the local area. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious and I would stay here again if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “such a great place and amazing city”
Reviews.Author: syphai32
Reviews.Content: we realy enjoyed our stay in emine sultan hotel ,nice welcoming and charming decoration let you feel that you are in right place.Mrs. Ã–zen and her staff made us comfortable and we felt ourself like our home. Istanbul is realy amazing ,i have never seen such a outstanding place as i travel for long time.I highly reccomend to see istanbul and stay in emine sultan hotel for the people want to travel turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would recommend to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: YusufJones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at this hotel for our honeymoon. The hotel is located at the doorstep of the famous Blue Mosque. We got collected by a lovely girl at the airport who escorted us to the hotel. There was a bit of a mix up as we got put in a room without a seaview but that was easily fixed. Our room was lovely, bright and clean. Bathroom was also spotless. The staff were brilliant, the manager was very welcoming and warm. They gave us lots of advice with regards to places to visit and eat. The breakfast was delicious. The breakfast room was located on the top floor so you have stunning views of the sea. There was plenty to eat and drink, from cold meats to fruit to cereal etc. We particularly enjoyed the homemade Dolma. The staff were very accommodating, particularly when it came to the start of Ramadan (fasting month) in which we asked for a small meal before dawn. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would love to return to it some time in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, low price but the best quality”
Reviews.Author: WARP333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Emine Sultan Hotel for a short trip. The hotel is located at the heart of the historical places, the rooms are clean and the food is OK. From the moment you enter the hotel, all staff is cheerful and helpful. They pay attention to each customer one-by-one. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends... especially the perfect scene of the Bosphorus from the top of the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Petite Hotel with nice people”
Reviews.Author: cochonvert
Reviews.Content: La Petite Hotel; We stayed 5 lovely nights in Emine Sultan; staff very helpfull and owner Ozen is very nice lady she help us for all our questions and try to do her best for right tips!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: am_patwardhan
Reviews.Content: I had a great 2 night stay at Emine Sultan Hotel on Dec 29 - Dec 30, 2010. There was a very personal touch to everything, from Hakan knowing my name when I walked into the hotel, to the bottle of complimentary Turkish red wine that welcomed me into the room. Hakan and Oguz were very friendly and forthcoming in answering my questions. The room is a little small, but given the location in Sultanahmet district, I was expecting it. Also, be prepared to be woken up early in morning by prayers from neighbouring Sultanahmet mosque. The complimentary breakfast spread is adequate and the view of Sea of Marmara from breakfast room is great. All in all, I will recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Eddiemack
Reviews.Content: The pre-travel arrangements were professional and complete in every detail. We were picked up at the airport as arranged by the hotel.The hotel location is deep in the heart of Istanbul's old town, just steps away from most of the important sites but more importantly in a quiet neighborhood setting. Restaurants, small shops and convenience stores are just a short cobblestoned walk away. The hotel is very unique in its design and decor. We felt like we were staying in a private residence... cozy, comfortable and well appointed. The small, immaculate room was well furnished and had 2 beds as we requested. A bottle of local wine was a nice touch and complimentary. The bathroom was private and well maintained. The staff is remarkable. The desk personnel went out of their way to make sure we had a pleasant stay... providing directions, restaurant recommendations, things to do and even escorted us to a somewhat hidden gem where we had a great dinner. The breakfast buffet, served rooftop overlooking the Bosphorus, was delicious with a wide selection of local favorites and homemade treats. We almost didn't want to leave after our 3 day stay, but our ship was waiting at the dock to take us on a 30 day cruise through the Mediterranean. This was my 4th trip to Istanbul but my first stay in the "Old Town"... It will not be my last!. I look forward to another Emine Sultan stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: pbrackmann
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul every year with a group of about 20 people. The Emine Sultan Hotel has always been amazingly supportive and helpful in providing for our needs and accommodating our stay. I will continue to return here year after year just because of the warm friendly smiles from the staff, the great location to restaurants and lots of cool historic stuff and the quiet off the beaten path location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: HT2010
Reviews.Content: The Emine Sultan was just what we were looking for. After very pleasant e-mails from the owner we (4 couples) arrived and everything was as we pictured it. It was a nice oasis in busy Istanbul and the location was PERFECT. Breakfasts in the top floor dining area were great. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The bedrooms were small but we thought this was part of the charm. They even had a driver who took us to dinner and picked us up one night . Highly recommended. Would have given it 5 stars if the rooms were a bit bigger and the beds softer.

Reviews.Title: “True Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JimmyAmrolia
Reviews.Content: If the Blue Mosque,Top Kapi,Cistern Bassilica,Grand bazar are on your itenarary look no further as this hotel in Sultanahmet s within walking distance of these Historical monuments,besides sitting on the corner of the Marmara Sea and the Bosphorus Straits.The owner Ms.Ozen Dalgin is the epitome of Turkish hospitality with her brothers and staff.My daughter was ill for 2 days and she was our doctor and family at that time and we thank her and her staff for the same.Her tips on istanbul were fantastic.The breakfast was fantastic and the hotel was clean and homely.The best restaurants were a stones throw and we had a dinner at different restaurants every night with the help of Mr.Oguz/Mr.Hakan.We came into and from Sabiha Gokcen Airport and the best way s to take a Shuttle ride from the Airport for Euro 10 per person as Taxis charge exhorbitantly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness & generosity are the key at Emine Sultan”
Reviews.Author: CaCToTian
Reviews.Content: The owner/manager of Emine Sultan (Ms. Dalgin) was amazingly friendly in helping us with arrangements for our holiday in Istanbul. The hotel is generous in its provision of free water (for the first night), a complimentary bottle of good-quality wine and an open-house approach to tea, coffee and home-made bikkies. Rooms are not huge, but they're comfortable and well appointed - again with generous supplies of toiletries and "extras". Location is convenient to the main sights in historic Sultanahmet area. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a "boutique" location in this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Fizzpup
Reviews.Content: We could not have been made more welcome in this hotel. We received friendly e-mails before we arrived and this high quality of service was maintained throughout our six night stay. We arrived in the early hours of the morning and a welcome snack was waiting for us in the room. It was our first time in Istanbul and we quickly found that the hotel is in the perfect location for walking to the key visitor attraction. Unfortunately we hit a spell of bad weather....had it been sunny there would have been fantastic views from the breakfast room over the Bosphorous. The breakfast is a treat.....something we looked forward to every morning. We also received very good recommendations from the hotel for dining in the evening...again within walking distance. The hotel is situated not far from the fishing quarter....there are suberb fish restaurants nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and attractively furnished......perhaps the only thing I miseed was some drawer space....but apart from that I could not fault it and would highly recommend the Emine Sultan to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff who did everything to make things easier!”
Reviews.Author: Ann261671
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emine Sultan when we needed accommodation on our return to Istanbul after a wonderful trip to Cappodocia. The staff let us leave our excess luggage at the hotel while we travelled to Cappodocia. They went out of their way to help us while we were there. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Blue Mosque and other attractions (you can see the Blue Mosque from the breakfast area on the roof). There are heaps of great places to eat closeby. .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Emine sultan”
Reviews.Author: koum_10
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable stay. People very kind and helpful. Very well located in old city. Breakfast could be improved but view from breakfast room is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ariki117
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and location. The hotel is very clean and well organized, and is ideally located for sight-seeing. Breakfast on the top floor offers nice views in the relative tranquility of Sultan Ahmet. Ozzie and the other staff were extremely helpful and courteous. From what I've heard and seen I think it would be hard to find better value than this hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: AirchairExplorer
Reviews.Content: After two weeks of 4 and 5 star hotels, we spent 3 days at the tiny Emine Sultan in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. We didn't expect this to be one of our favourite stays during the trip, but it was. - The room and washroom were both tiny. The bed not bad, but not as comfortable as some. The sheets and towels were fresh every day, but not of the quality of the 5 star hotels. The room was actually pretty! - Good solid blinds shutout the sun and the view from neighbouring hotels, when needed. - The stairs were easier and quicker to take than the tiny elevator. - There was some noise transfer from activities on the stairs and landing. - The food and food choices were simple and adequate. The breakfast area had a nice view and became a social area for hotel residents to touch bases and share their experiences from the day before. - Only hotel to give us a complementary bottle of 'welcome' wine. Water on first day also free. - Several mosques in the immediate area, so at 6:15 am you get several versions of the call to prayer. We actually enjoyed this part of our experience. - Location is great. Very short walk to the Calvary Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Haghia Sophia Basilica, Topkapi Palace, underground cistern, and the shops/restaurants of the Sultanahmet. With a little more energy you are quickly at the 300 year old 'New Mosque', Egyptian Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, and Galata Bridge. The owner and staff were very friendly and helpful. We wanted to go to a football game and ended up going with a staff member who is also a Galatasaray fan. He got us the tickets and led us through the public transportation system with thousands of commuters and football fans. If you want low key, friendly, inexpensive, clean, convenient, charming, and casual ... I recommend the Emine Sultan. If you want romantic, elegant, expensive, plush, and first class service ... I recommend the Crowne Plaza, Four Seasons, or Ciragan Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: plague40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Yes rooms are small but who cares? they are clean and quiet. You are only there to sleep anyway. Service is excellent and staff very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A balanced review of this little place”
Reviews.Author: mijb
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a stay at Emine Sultan I felt compiled to write a review for the first time ever as the rave reviews made us stay there in the first place. We are fortunate enough to travel for 3-4 months of every year and always stay in small well-priced accommodation wherever we go in the World (even some homestays), never in big impersonal hotels. For seasoned travellers there are some key points to selecting a place to stay, and most of the reviews here don't really cover these succinctly enough. So here goes (Emine Sultan comments in brackets): Airport transfers provided (very good indeed and reasonably priced too) Free WIFI throughout that works well (excellent, also a free internet computer in reception) Good breakfast (more than adequate) Coffee/tea making (available free all day together with snacks, juices & fruit in b'fast room- excellent) Quiet for sleeping (you can't get away from the early morning mosque call anywhere in Istanbul! Otherwise adequate....providing the others on your tiny 3-room floor are considerate when coming and going...which our American neighbours were not at times) Comfortable beds (sadly no, three of the four of us on this trip still have bad backs from the over-firm mattresses) Room of adequate size (again sadly no, and the bathrooms are miniscule.....however having peeked into a corner bedroom when being cleaned this certainly appeared larger....request one of these in advance if staying here) Fridge in room (yes- great) Bar (no) Views (good from higher floor rooms, and excellent from the little rooftop terrace) Location (not bad, a bit off the beaten track, but still in the old quarter. Akbiyik Caddesi is full of restaurants, bars and places to stay if you want to be closer to night spots and the sights) Friendly & helpful staff (OK, but the place is generally very quiet and low-key) Hope these specifics help others. This has to be one of the tiniest places we've stayed in. There are many other similar Ottoman-style places to stay scattered all around these streets which all appear to be very similar. One last thing: beware 'bumping'. We were told on arrival that we could only stay for 3 of the 4 nights we were booked, as they had overbooked, and that we would have to be moved somewhere else for the last night. We politely pointed out we would not be moving anywhere and that it was their problem to resolve. Unfortunately some other poor people must have been bumped though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel, Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: diegodogCalgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Emine Sultan for 4 nights in October, and chose it based on Trip Advisor reviews and our desire for a quiet but accessible-to-sights location. We were not disappointed. From our earliest emails with Ozen, to the easily arranged ride from the airport, to the actual stay and departure, everything was as we had hoped. The Emine Sultan is a charming boutique hotel with a very helpful staff. We stayed in the 4th floor room adjacent to the breakfast room. While it was somewhat small, with creative organizing, it was still fine even though we had 4 suitcases with us (we'd been on a 2 week cruise). Managing all 4 suitcases in the small elevator was challenging, though, but again, possible. The bathroom was fine too, although it had a small tub/shower combo which really wouldn't have worked well for an adult bath. But it was terrific for sitting in and soaking tired feet while enjoying a glass of wine from the complimentary bottle provided at check-in! Even though our days were mostly rainy during our time in Istanbul, from our window, we got the view of the Blue Mosque to the left and the Sea of Marmara to the right. As far as outside sound, we didn't really experience what we characterize as noise, but then we don't expect total dead silence in a city or even want that. We both expected and appreciated the beauty of hearing the call to prayer early in the morning. Breakfast was good - it had cereal, some omelet, hardboiled eggs, fresh tomatoes, olives, really good feta cheese, cold cuts, pastries, etc. There was also fruit and of course juices and coffee or tea. We thought this hotel was very well located. Pretty well everything a visitor wants to see is within fairly easy walking distance, but for those of us who like to wear heels, beware. As in most other older cities, heels don't work well on cobblestones (wet or otherwise) or uneven hilly pavement. The Blue Mosque is just a few minutes away and the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace not much further. This is a great area for exploring with its surprises around every corner, not to mention all the cats for those of us missing our pets at home. There are lots of food choices close by in various price ranges and the hotel gave us good suggestions. If you haven't chosen anything otherwise, pretty well every restaurant will have a menu outside with someone giving you a business card so you don't forget them. Make sure you try the freshly squeezed pomegranate juiceoffered from many stands; it was one of the food highlights of our stay and so much better than in the bottles we buy at home at the store. Staying at the Emine Sultan contributed so much to our enjoyment of our first trip to Istanbul - it is welcoming, comfortable, safe, clean, good value, and truly charming. We whole-heartedly recommend staying at the Emine Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Great Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Flyers74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emine Sultan in October 2010 and had a great stay at the hotel. It is perfectly situated 3 to 4 blocks from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bazzaar. Many food options are available within one block. Our room was very clean, including the bathroom, and was decorated in a very quaint and inviting way. The bed was comfortable, the roof top breakfast provided many good choices to eat, and the staff was very helpful. We were able to book tours at reception. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Emine Sultan on our honeymoon. We were there for 4 nights. The Emine Sultan is the best hotel in Europe we have stayed in. The friendlness from Ozen, Ali and all the staff is exceptional and they went well out of there way to give us a good experience. The hotel is excellently located to explore sultanahmet which is the main part of touristy istanbul. We were reluctant to go to Turkey initially more so out of unfamiliarity with this part of the world but one day we will definately return and will be staying at the Emine Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant botique hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Paterfamilias99
Reviews.Content: Two very pleasant nights here were perfect ending to Seabourn cruise. Superior service by owner Ozen and concierge Hakan including arrangements for special treat celebrating wife's 80th birthday. Also, well organized local tours offered by Ozen's brother (Aussie Tours). Comfortable, spacious (for area) room with a great view on level two - even better view from breakfast room on level four and roof garden on level five (elevator service to level four). Breakfast buffet of surprising variety of Turkish and international delicacies. Excellent location in Sultanahmet within reach (easy walk for hale and hearty) of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Museum, Grand/Spice Bazaars and others. Ask for rececommendation re excellent seafood restaurant in nearby fish market area that provides transport to and from hotel. Overall best hotel expeniece abroad in many years of travelling. Do yourself a favor - book here if you want a good room at reasonable price in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Stockholm-bromma
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Emine Sultan. The hotel is very small, we counted 10 rooms. Our stay could not have been better. - The location is great, very close to the Blue Mosque in the Sultanahmed area. - The hotel has a terrace and a breakfast restaurant with an excellent view over the Marmara Lake/Bosporus inlet. - The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. - Rooms were clean, ours had a view over the lake. - The price was quite reasonable. For our purpose - a couple of days sight-seeing in Istanbul - this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & caring hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizLeisureFred
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week together with our family. Ã–zen, who runs the hotel, was giving us two rooms next to each other (there are just four rooms per floor, and we got the nicest ones). The rooms are small, but it works. The kids simply loved the terrace (we did too) and the possibility to go up to the breakfast room during the day to take a cup of apple tea or some sweets. Our smallest son had his birthday while we stayed at the hotel and Ã–zen (who has a son in the same age) had arranged a small present (and a cake at breakfast) for him. It was just unbelieveably friendly & caring. The location of the hotel is actually quite good, within 7-8 minutes, you would be at Sultanahmet which is where the main sights are (and from which you can take the excellent tram). It is also close to the Bazaar which is a definite must if you're e.g. into high quality leather goods but do not want to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “WounderfuL Stay ...”
Reviews.Author: AsadTariq
Reviews.Content: I stayed in emine sultan hotel for 3 night while travelling from karachi to london. I must say that its a wounderfuL place and a gem in istanbuL. All the tourist attractions are very close by, just a few minutes walk and the hotel can also arrange tours for you which are really nice. The service was great. From the airport I was picked up and everything was great. Especially gratefuL to hakan for his guidence.

Reviews.Title: “If you would want to come "home" away from home .....”
Reviews.Author: karian_tb
Reviews.Content: My brother Ä±nvÄ±ted me to come for a short trÄ±p to Istanbul and I joÄ±ned hÄ±m, from Sydney AustralÄ±a, at the EmÄ±ne Sultan Hotel Ä±n Istanbul. The four days spent Ä±n that lovely hotel were unforgetable. ThÄ±s Ä±s a beautÄ±ful boutÄ±que hotel, managed by a young, energetÄ±c lady and that was notÄ±ceable Ä±n every lÄ±ttle detaÄ±l. The locatÄ±on Ä±s close to all the maÄ±n hÄ±storÄ±cal attractÄ±ons. The rooms, 10 only and almost always booked, were beautÄ±fully decorated. Breakfast, whÄ±ch Ä±s Ä±ncluded Ä±n the prÄ±ce, was fresh and abundant. The whole crew of personel, traÄ±ned by Ã–zen Ä±n her frÄ±endly effÄ±cÄ±ent way, was very helpful and knowledgable and every tÄ±me we came back to the hotel, Ä±t was lÄ±ke comÄ±ng home to a haven of luxury and personal attentÄ±on, havÄ±ng receÄ±ved specÄ±al tÄ±ps from the receptÄ±onÄ±sts or the manager, about where to shop or what hÄ±storÄ±cal places to vÄ±sÄ±t. I would greatly recommend a vÄ±sÄ±t to magÄ±cal, hÄ±storÄ±cal Istanbul, startÄ±ng from thÄ±s lovely hotel and your safe place to come home to, tÄ±me and agaÄ±n. It wÄ±ll not be the last tÄ±me that we have been there .....

Reviews.Title: “cute, clean, and accommodating...and i'm not just talking about the rooms. ;)”
Reviews.Author: hapaforlife
Reviews.Content: my best friend and i decided to explore the beautiful city of istanbul and found this hotel after searching various reviews on tripadvisor. we couldn't have been more thrilled! after a long journey to the city and a 20-30 minute taxi ride from the airport we were warmly greeted by kadir, our concierge, who gave us a map of the city and a quick run down of turkish adventures. we were then led to an adorable room with an (only slightly) obscured view of the bosphorous and more importantly a complimentary bottle of red wine :) (not to mention air conditioning). the staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, and continuously offered suggestions/recommendations on things/places to see in the city. (both oze and kadir were great). the surrounding area is quaint, but there are enough restaurants and shops to keep you occupied. while many friends had suggested we stay in the more secular area of taksim, my friend and i both agreed we were much happier to be staying in the historic area of sultanahmet. Not only did we feel as though we were, in fact, in a different country, but we were also fortunate enough to walk past the blue mosque and the hagia sophia on a daily (and nightly) basis. the hotel is a short walk to historic treasures, the tram station, and divan yolu street. it is convenient, comfortable, and the breakfast spread is amazing!!! overall we were both extremely pleased with our experience at emine sultan.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY”
Reviews.Author: asp1228
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Emine Sultan Hotel. Ozen and staff were absolutely the best. They were like a little family and treated us like family, too. Our room was small, but immaculate. The breakfasts were delicious, especially the stuffed grape leaves that were made by Ozen's aunt. We had the opportunity to sit with Ozen and her little son on the morning of our departure. We shared Turkish delight and Turkish tea. Turkey is a wonderful country, with very warm people. One day we hope to go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: MrNiap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emine Sultan Hotel for seven days and it was nothing but great. Excellent service from start to end. When we checked in we got a quick briefing in what to do and see in Istanbul and som drinks. The hotel also cooperats with a travel agency so we easily booked all our trips in Istanbul at the hotel. The hotel i placed close to all important sights and pretty close to the tram which takes you to the others side of Istanbul. The rooms (double) was large enough, very clean and had a welcome package on the bed containing och a bottle of wine and two glasses. Everyone in the staff was very helpful and friendly. It's quite a small hotel so the atomsphere is very familiar. When I go back t Istanbul I will definitiy stay here again and cannot nothing but recommend this to anyone who is going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: DeeGill
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Emine Sultan was wonderful. We arrived in the evening and were leaving the following morning for a 6 day tour, then returning for a further 4 days in Istanbul. There had been some misunderstanding with our booking and we were not registered for that first night! But no problem Ozzie found a room for us without any fuss and agreed to look after 2 bags for us whilst we were away. A great way to start a visit to a new country! The hotel is perfectly located within easy walking distance of all the attractions whilst being far enough away from the main tourist streets to maintain some peace and quiet. Rooms are lovely (a little small and storage space is tight), spotlessly clean with good views of the sea. The staff are all very friendly and helpful with a wealth of information about where to go and what to see and also what to avoid. Breakfast on the 4th floor each morning was delightful, with the ladies who looked after it more than willing to cater to any requests. I look forward to revisiting in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel with Great Views and Location”
Reviews.Author: frompoletopole
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located a 10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque. It is on a quiet street corner, a world away from the nearby touristy streets. We were welcomed upon arrival with a bottle of wine and 2 glasses. The day of our arrival, we actually met the food and wine author of the Istanbul section of the Lonely Planet guides who was visiting the hotel. It made our visit all the more interesting and confirmed all the great places to eat. You will have to get out of Sultanahmet to get some good food. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the serving staff is so friendly you feel so much at home. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, even though we asked a lot of unusual question requiring further research. There is a lot of safety. At night they monitor the cameras that show every floor and the restaurant. Rooms were fairly small, as one might expect in a renovated Ottoman house. Nevertheless, the staff and the quality of the facility make up for that. The hotel also offers you bottled water as much as you want, free of charge (tap water is not safe to drink in Istanbul). The restaurant is open 24/7 for guests, who can help themselves to juices, coffee and teas any time they want. The hotel can arrange pick-up from the airport, but there is a charge for this service. It is nice to do this because you can avoid the touts at the airport, as well as the cab drivers. All the hotel staff are fluent in English and they are always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed, Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: Lyndonm
Reviews.Content: Located a stones throw from the Blue Mosque and a brisk walk from the Grand Bazaar the Emine Sultan could not be better placed. In addition the whole place is spotless, the buffet breakfast excellent (ask for Turkish coffee and don't miss the RoseHip jam) and all staff are helpful and well informed. Our room was lovely, if a little small, with views of both the Mosque and the sea. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel, Extraordinary Staff”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorAE1
Reviews.Content: The finest feature of this charming hotel is its amazingly welcoming and helpful staff. The rooms and common areas are remarkably clean and tastefully decorated. The typical Turkish breakfast (served on the fourth floor with an outstanding view of the Sea of Marmara) is of better than average quality. A short walk from the hotel to the Blue Mosque and other attractions. Streets in the vicinity are a bit noisy at night but not nearly as active as others nearby. Beds are quite comfortable. My only criticism is that the rooms are very small, especially by U.S. standards. Nevertheless, this hotel serves as a lovely refuge of tranquility in a hectic city. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in the middle of all the Istanbul attractions”
Reviews.Author: Marian_10
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Emine Sultan Hotel. It is situated perfectly: just a few minutes walk from a lot of the beautiful sights of Istanbul. The family run hotel offers 10 rooms and a great service. The rooms are not that big, but comfortable. The cleanliness is excellent. We loved to start our day at the breakfast room with a wonderful view over the Bosporus. Breakfast was always excellent. And we loved the very friendly staff. We can recommend it to everyone planning a visit to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful staff, Good price! Can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: GlenLivet
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in and around Istanbul staying at the Emine Sultan Hotel for 8 nights. This is a great boutique hotel. It is only two years old (as of 2010) and very well appointed. They have an elevator to the upper floor rooms. The location is literally in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and within a 10 minute walk to the tram station. There are nearby restaurants, bars, a convenience store and even a shopping bazaar. The room was small but very adequate for two people. Our room (302) had a view over the Sea of Marmara and the Bosporus and I recommend getting this room. The room had a western toilet, shower, couch, flat screen TV, and wireless internet. When we arrived we were greeted with tea and a bottle of the local wine. The staff took time when we arrived to review the area and Istanbul in general. They were also very helpful making transportation arrangements. All the desk staff we met had very good English. The included breakfast, although not very creative, was more then adequate, fresh, and wholesome. It included cheeses, meats, eggs, cereals, yogurt, and pastries. The staff would prepare Turkish coffee on request. The highlight of breakfast was the wonderful view from the glassed-in breakfast room of Istanbul and the Bosporus. It was a fantastic way to start each morning. There is also a rooftop open deck from which you can see the Blue mosque and Aya Sophia. This was a wonderful sight at night. The only caveat I must mention is that there is a minaret a short distance from the hotel and I must say the call to prayer early in the morning was a bit startling the first day. After that, it just became part of the ambience. The neighborhood overall had little traffic and was very quiet at night with the exception of the occasional cat noise. Bottom line: I enthusiastically recommend the Emine Sultan Hotel. When I return to Istanbul, I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Scottyr1977
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel right in the middle of the old town and close to all the sites. Ozen and her staff are very welcoming and friendly and the rooms are charming. There is a free bottle of wine wrapped up in a cute box with glasses and you can tell that meticulous detail has gone into the room. The rooms aren't huge, but who comes to Turkey to hang out in a hotel room? To me, they were just fine. Even the bathroom had beautiful sea shells and soaps and there was a nice quaint feel about them. Breakfast was simple but elegant. To me, the mark of a good hotel is a) that everything works b) its service and c) its location. The Emine Sultan fits all of these (and its reasonably priced too). It even has free internet which is a plus. I think the effort that the owner and management put into the place is starting to pay off with its consistently good ratings on Trip Advisor. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but we had expected more from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bufje
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel upon recommendations of TripAdvisor. A warm welcome. We got offered (alcoholic) welcome drinks. A free bottle of wine in the room on arrival. The bedroom is nicely decorated but tiny. No room for a chair.The bathroom is very small, especially for tall people. Amenity kits provided in a box on the dresser. There is room for improvement regarding the breakfast offering. Perhaps they could serve Turkish coffee. But what a great location. Within walking distance to Sultanahmet Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. When they failed to provide our transfer to the airport, they solved it by paying a taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: silverwolf22
Reviews.Content: The hotel: This is a boutique hotel converted from an old yali, or wooden seaside house in the historic district of Sultanahmet, not a large, soulless hotel chain - stay at the Hilton if you are after a spacious, carpeted room with no personality. The view from the terrace is of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque - especially stunning at night. The area feels quite safe, though single ladies shouldn't venture out too late at night - a pair of us went for a nargileh at about 10pm to 11pm and it was very quiet, though the streets were well lit. Service: Pre-arrival communication was very friendly and prompt. Check in was smooth, half a bottle of wine and free bottles of water were available in the fridge. What distinguishes the Emine is the service and the smiles - especially Akhan who fixed us up a cup of tea at 8pm our first night after we came back with aching feet, having explored the Grand Bazaar. The hotel felt like a home - we spent ages larking about in the dining room, taking photos, sipping tea, chilling out. The room: We stayed in a 3-bedder and although the room was small-ish, it was perfectly adequate for us. After all, we weren't visting Istanbul just to stay in our rooms and watch the flat screen plasma tv! The room was clean, with floral bedspreads, wonderful wooden window blinds and some white roller blinds. They mostly face East, so if light is a problem, bring an eye mask. The hotel rooms were not built for noise insulation (remember it is a converted old house) and you can hear other guests and the lift. Bring ear plugs to solve problem - we hardly even heard the morning call to prayer, our sleep was so deep. The bathroom was a little musty, but very clean. The hotel provides bath towels, slippers (a nice touch!) and face towels. Breakfast: Breakfast was a cold Turkish breakfast - much much better than many a cold breakfast provided at hotels in Europe. The spread included boiled eggs, pastries, borek, dolmades, cereals, fresh yoghurt, a basket of fresh breads, about 8 different types of home made jams (We tried them all!), soft cheese, cold meat, and sweet pastries. Jars of turkish delight, apricots and cookies were also available. There was also coffee, tea, Nesquik for kids, Turkish tea, apple tea - a more than adequate breakfast. Overall: The Emine Sultan is a boutique hotel that represents excellent value for money, (EUR105 for a three bedder per night) is located right in the heart of Sultanahmet (walking distance to the Big Three: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya & Topkapi) and has exceptional service. The breakfast and terrace are plus points.

Reviews.Title: “The Emine Sultan is a wonderful family owned, moderately priced boutique hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: travelkelly
Reviews.Content: We always look for accommodations walking distance from the sights and after reading many reviews, decided the Emine Sultan in Istanbul would be a good location. We took the overnight train from Greece to Turkey, and were told to call the hotel for a pickup when we arrived at the train station. We stepped off the train at around11am, and called the hotel. We were told we would be picked up shortly and to just wait inside. Just a short time later, our driver arrived and quickly showed us to the hotel's van. As soon as we got in, we knew we had made the right choice. The van was beautiful, plush, and actually had turkish carpets on the floor! We sat back and enjoyed a luxurious ride to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, Hakan was quick to make us feel at home. While our room was being readied (we were there before check in but, no problem) we were invited to sit in the lobby area. This is a lovely seating area, very cozy and well appointed. We were served chai and our host chatted with us until our bags were settled into our room. We were shown up the elevator to our room, which was a pleasant surprise also. The room was larger than we expected, and had a refrigertor, tv, and three windows that looked out over the harbor. Every day a large bottle of water was delivered to our refrigerator,and we were given a welcome bottle of wine to begin our stay. We were already very happy about our choice, when we were invited to go "upstairs" for a beer to unwind before heading out to explore. So up we went to the rooftop restaurant, where breakfast is served each morning. What a view of the sea and Blue Mosque. Breakfast is plentiful and varied and included. Coffee, tea, cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, olives, tomatoes, breads and the best little cookies! Then we went up one more floor to a rooftop garden terrace, where you can enjoy your snack and the views. The location is fantastic, just a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sofia, and of course, the Grand Bazaar. We walked everywhere, it was close enough to all the sights to be able to go out early, come back to the hotel in late afternoon, and go back out for the evening festivities. We were there during Ramadan, and every night there is a celebration around the Blue Mosque and along the Hippodrome, so this location was the best. Whenever we had questions about things to see, or places to go, the staff was more than helpful and very friendly. In fact, we sometimes met them out in the evening and were introduced to their friends also enjoying the evenings in Istanbul. We are already thinking of our next trip to Turkey and we will definitely spend more time in Istanbul and definitely stay at Emine Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in centre of the old town”
Reviews.Author: H989
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Emine Sultan and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The location is excellent - right in the centre of the old town - and the views from the breakfast room/rooftop terrace are stunning. The Blue Mosque is clearly visible (note that, as a muslim country, the prayer call can be heard every morning between 5am-6am, but with over 1000 mosques in the city you would find it difficult to escape anyewhere in the city), as is the sea and the Asian side of Istanbul. Great location for sightseeing and under 5 mins walk to the nearest tram stop. The staff are the friendliest I have come across yet at a hotel - they arranged taxis for me for business and recommended and booked fantastic restaurants in the evening. The rooms are thoughtfully laid out and very comfortable. They do go out of their way to make your stay a good one - I even tasted lovely warm homemade biscuits with my tea in the afternoon. I stayed here for 5 nights in Jan (on recommendation from a colleague) and would agree with all the positive comments written on this site I'd have no hesitation in staying there again if ever back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: david999
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat disappointed. The room was tiny and poorly laid out. There was not even one chair. There was a streetlight outside the window and the shade was transparent so I needed to wear eyeshades at night to sleep. The breakfast was a basic cold Turkish breakfast. My wife asked for an egg and that was not possible. On the other hand the staff is very nice and friendly. The location is great. Best of al the terrace and breakfast room have fantastic views of the Bosporus and Mosque. There are probably some other hotels with great views and better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Glamanda
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in Turkey - 4 nights at Emine which we booked after reading all the rave reviews and so our expectations were very high. Whilst we were happy with our stay with no complaints, it fell a little short and it wasn't quite the incredible experience that we were expecting. The location is excellent - very convenient walking distance to all the sites. The room was tiny (for Euros 105 per night) and generally clean but unfortunately, there was rubbish left in the shower for 2 nights which was a bit disappointing since the reviews highlighted the cleaniness of the place. Suggest to shop around for tours and not necessarily booking through the hotel. We wanted to do a day trip to Gallipoli and we were given 3 significantly different prices (1 lower price before we arrived, 1 higher price + offer for a very expensive private tour upon check-in). We ended up booking with another agent who was cheaper. The breakfast was fine, pretty standard, nothing extraordinary. There was a bit of a mosquito problem which was odd in the middle of winter. Also, the morning prayer is quite a loud wake-up call so if you want to sleep in then keep the windows closed! All in all, it was a pretty comfortable stay but if coming back to this part of Istanbul, I would like to try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but shop around”
Reviews.Author: Lisgya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over New Year, the small hotel is clean and the room although small comfortable enough. So whilst I have nothing negative to say, I find it hard to believe that it is rated so highly when there is so much choice out there. If I were to visit Istanbul again, I would certainly check out a few more hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but you can find better”
Reviews.Author: len06
Reviews.Content: There are 100's of hotel in Istanbul and I am pretty sure you can find better than this hotel for value/quality. I am not sure why this hotel is rated so high on TA. It makes me think that a lots of friends/family must contribute. Do your own research and don't always trust what your read. We did enjoyed our stay, but feel that we could have done better for the money. Good points - Good location ( Sultanahmet , just behind the blue mosque) - Friendly staff/good email communication - Good Shower (also clean, even if the shower was leaking) - Nice terrace with views (lots of hotel have the same) Average points - Room was adequate put slightly small. - Quite Noisy (you will hear the Mosque everywhere, it's more Hotel noise, like people in corridor, lift door, neighbours etc...) - Breakfast was correct but nothing special....You will get all the usual.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Erkybaby
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Istanbul, FULL STOP! Amazing staff, amazing location and a fantastic view from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews and STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Leyland-wanderer
Reviews.Content: I have ploughed through the reviews to read the ones by people who didn't enjoy the experience. It took some doing, I considered what they had to say and then decided that some people are probably not happy anywhere. If you are in any doubt then read the positive reviews - they really are accurate. I stayed here for 4 nights in December with my wife and two friends. The hotel owner had arranged transfers for us from the airport and, on arrival at the hotel we were offered drinks. Being tired and not thinking straight, two of us asked if they had a beer and Hakan on reception didn't bat an eyelid. What we realised shortly afterwards was he had to run out to a nearby shop to buy two bottles of beer for us (at no charge) - and that just typifies the level of service they offer you throughout your stay.
