Nothing is too much trouble. The reality is that this is a small hotel in the old part of Istanbul that prides itself on it's level of service and cleanliness. There isn't a luxurious bar area and the breakfast may seem limited (however it is more than adequate and the fresh breads and home made jams are excellent) but at 85 euros a night what do you want? The rooms are spacious for two people and are cleaned to a high level each day with clean towels provided. Water is provided in the fridge when you arrive along with a complimentary half bottle of wine - I've stayed in more expensive so called luxury hotels that don't do that. So, you may be woken fairly early in the morning by the call to prayers from the nearby minarets but we are the visitors to their city and it was a small price to pay for such atmosphere. Tea and coffee is available all day in the fourth floor breakfast area with stunning views over the Sea of Marmara and the entrance to the Bosphorous. As we were leaving Ozen, the owner, suggested we check in on line for our flights. I was going to use the terminal for guests in the lobby but instead she took me to her office to use her computer because the printer would be quicker for us. Small touches all the time that grow to give you a very satisfying experience of staying in Istanbul. Basically you should have no worries in booking this hotel if you want cleanliness, a friendly atmosphere and a location that is ideal for tourists. Should any of my friends think of going to Istanbul I would have no hesitation in encouraging them to visit the city and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a warm welcome you would be crazy to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Dunc80
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to apologise to Ozen and her team, it has been manic since returning from holiday and im sure we are one of many users who read trip advisor but don't actually have an account - not the case now!! So to the hotel, it is in a great location with lovely views, the rooms are finishd to a good standard and with nice touches like a free bottle of wine and bottled water which sets things off on a good note! Located just a short walk from the Blue Mosque yet still far enough from the tourists, the hotels location ensures you can appreciate all the very best that Istanbul has to offer whlst still being able to have a relaxing break at the sane time! However what really made the hotel so special for us was the staff who went above and beyond our expectations and were absolutely brilliant from start to finish, Ozen, Borhan and Hakan thank you so much for making it such a fantastic stay, we will see you again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: judithvb1
Reviews.Content: The rooms, views and sevice are first rate! The hotel is located next to The Blue Mosque which is illuminated at night and can be seen from the roof terrace. Other major attractions are within walking distance or a short tram dive away. We were made to feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We will definitely keep in touch and strongly recommend this delightful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: james9944
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were welcomed with a complementary drink, we felt very much at home in this hotel. The hotel is small (only 10 bedrooms) but our room was attractively furnished with a complementary bottle of wine waiting for us and cold bottled water in the fridge. The bathroom was bright, clean and modern. Ozen (the owner) and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful with advice on where to visit in the city. The hotel is very close to all the major attractions. If we go to Istanbul again, we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: beattybabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Emine Sultan for 2 nights prior to joining our group tour in Instanbul and wished it could've been longer. We were welcomed from the moment we arrived and taken straight to the breakfast room where we met the lovely Ozen and had our first (of many) Turkish coffees. Every effort was made by the entire staff to make us feel at home and answer any and all of our questions. All their suggestions of places to see and things to do were spot on. I had a wonderful Turkish bath at the local place that Ozen (the owner) uses - very authentic. It was my birthday while there, and we all celebrated with a delicious cake and more apple tea and turkish coffee. Our daughter joined us in Istanbul after our 2 week Insight Turkey tour (highly recommended), and we dropped into Emine Sultan for breakfast with her straight from the airport - a wonderful, authentic introduction for her to Istanbul. This place has the gift of hospitality with a beautiful personal touch. Everything else has been written in previous reviews. Highly recommend this place if you want a small boutique hotel in a great location with excellent service. Feel we have made lovely friendships with the family at Emine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: Caledon_OntarioMarsh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Emine Sultan Hotel and can't say enough about how welcome Ozen and her staff made us feel. Borhan and the staff went out of their way to make us feel at home every moment we were there. Recommending places to eat, places to visit and even taking us to a Turkish bath. What an experience that was and everyone visiting Turkey should experience a Turkish bath. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul and looking for a place that feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: BlacksburgJohn
Reviews.Content: The folks at Emine Sultan were great. Very helpful. They met us at the ferry port so they could drive us to the hotel (we had rented cars and were very uncertain about driving through Istanbul). The view of the Blue Mosque, the Bosporus, and the city scape of Istanbul was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LondonManic
Reviews.Content: Yes we checked Trip Advisor before going but Emine Sultan outshone any of its reviews. Ozen has created a truly memorable place to stay and for all the right reasons - from the warm emails she sent before our departure to the service we received when we were there from start to finish. The rooms are all immaculately clean and tastefully furnished. Her staff are warm and welcoming from Burhan, Oguz, Ali and of course Hakan in reception to Fatoush upstairs in the dining room. So much has already been said in praise of Emine Sultan - we agree with it all. We could not have asked for more from a perfect stay. Thank you all at Emine Sultan

Reviews.Title: “Yet another good review!”
Reviews.Author: bodomouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. As others have said, it was excellent - clean, friendly, helpful staff etc etc and we would stay there again were we to return to Istanbul. A few notes - we used the shuttle minivan to get to and from the airport (Sabiha Gochen) and that was good - door to door for 10 Euros each and you can book on line before you go. We found one particularly good place to eat - Hamdi - on Eminonu square - had a turkish bath at Suleymaniye baths (where couples can stay together - 34 Euros each - a touch overpriced but you've got to do it at least once! and spent a very pleasant day going to the Princes Islands (3 YTL each way for a 90 minute journey). Other than that, we just did all the 'sights'. A great break.

Reviews.Title: “Small and very friendly - don't miss this”
Reviews.Author: KristinStockholm
Reviews.Content: Ã–zem, Borhan, Hakan and the others take amazing care of their guests, they spoil you with fantastic service from the second you put your foot in the door. They were incredibly engaged and gave us such a warm welcome, they made you feel right at home from the minute we got there. They go out of their way to make your stay in Istanbul something very special. I highly recommend this place. It is not extravagant luxury but it is a lovely place with gorgeous views from the breakfast room and the rooftop. The location is perfect for checking out all the historic sights. The fascinating city of Istanbul mixed with our fantastic stay at Emine Sultan Hotel made this the perfect weekend getaway. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just forget it...”
Reviews.Author: Benzon1960
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for shallow luxury or empty hearted extravaganza - well don't look any further. If, however, you are looking for a genuine and warm hospitality, outstanding service and friendliness from a very committed staff and a small not too crowdy hotel which seems to focus on atmosphere and top-quality within its class - well you have found it! We decided to go on a short break to Istanbul and chose to stay at the Emine Sultan Hotel based on comments from this site. From the very first enquiry Ã–zen, the female owner, has been such a warm experience. She has taken personal care of all details and also arranged for a very smoot VIP pick up upon arrival at the airport. I have decided to keep our mail exchange with Ã–zen because of her ability to communicate in a direct and indulging manner leaving you feeling like you are about to visit close friends. When we arrived at the hotel we were met by Burhan, the very pleasant and highly effecient hotel manager. Burhan knows everything worth knowing about Istanbul. Like any concierge at some of the world's finest hotels (And I have stayed on a number of those) he has the right attitude, the connections and the rare talent for organising - all leading to a perfect fulfillment of your desires. Certainly a person you should take advice from. In one instance I wanted to visit a hamam (Tyrkish Bath) but didn't fancy some of the more touristic places. Burhan then arranged for my visit to his personal hamam - if you ever dreamt of a tyrkish bath - don't miss it! As from other reviews you will see that the hotel is perfectly placed for visiting all the cultural gems of Istanbul. But so are many others. You should chose the Emine Sultan if you appreciate that rare experience leaving a hotel stay much more than just a practical question of having a place to stay in. We will most certainly be back. Brgds/Anette & Jan Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pet8l
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Emine Sultan Hotel based on others reviews on TripAdvisor - thank you all for your advice :) This is a great little boutique hotel in the Sultanahmet area, very convenient to all the tourist spots. It is literally a couple of minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, ten minutes to the Topkapi Palace and about 15 to the Grand Bazaar. To venture further afar there is a tram line about 5 mins walk away. Our room on the second floor was light, airy and beautifully presented, with a view of the Marmara Sea as a bonus. The Terrace/breakfast room on the fourth floor has an even more spectacular 180 view across the sea. The staff were very friendly and helpful, including giving us access to a much appreciated shower before a late night flight (after we had already checked out). We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would love to return at some stage in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the mark”
Reviews.Author: SrimathiSalalahOman
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The staff is friendly. Very small rooms. And break fast spread is very limited. No power back up .No facilities of a regular star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: BrigittaInSydney
Reviews.Content: Emine Sultan is more than just a brilliantly located and comfortable place to stay. Ozen and her staff (Buhran and Hakan and another lovely chap whose name escapes me now) were warm and friendly, but not intrusive, helpful and interested, but not pushy. They went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable, and were so sweet with our six-year-old son. When my partner had to change his plans and return home earlier than expected, Ozen immediately reduced our room rate from three persons to two, even though my son and I stayed on in a room for three. And when we left in a car for the airport without seeing Ozen to say goodbye, she rang the driver's mobile to wish us a safe journey. I would recommend Emine Sultan to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Apart from the above, the view from the terrace is breathtaking and it is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophya, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and tram stops.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever used!”
Reviews.Author: kmk298
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 10-day stay at the Emine Sultan. It was fabulous. We chose the hotel based on other reviews on this site -- great service, very nice rooms, location, and size. It was perfect. I can honestly say it was one of the highlights of our trip knowing that we always had a comfortable and friendly base to return to, any time during the day. We enjoyed our morning chats with Ã–zen and Borhan (I apologize if I did not spell his name correctly!) over breakfast and their recommendations on unique places to go. We were in the city for a good amount of time and wanted to make sure we experienced some of the smaller sights and interesting areas of the city. Everything on our trip went off without a hitch, and I credit that mostly to the crew at the Emine Sultan. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RichieR
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews read on Trip Advisor. Yes, it is a great little hotel offering really good rooms at an excellent rate. Ozen and her staff were really helpful before and during our stay. The location is perfect for visiting the Blue Mosque etc. I was worried area may be too tourist orientated but plenty of locals enjoying the sights and restaurants. The roof terrace is an ideal place for a late night drink to enjoy the incredible views. A great hotel from which to enjoy a fantastic city full of friendly and helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: emort
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Emine Sultan for 3 weeks, July, August, 2009. Why would anyone stay anywhere else in Istanbul? All other reviewers positive comments are right...every member of staff is handpicked by Ozen, the wonderful owner, for friendliness and efficiency. Rooms are beautiful and spotless, breakfast unbeatable, service totally efficient, but most of all I was made to feel like family. Their care of me and kindness completed the package. Almost hate to spread the word in case it's booked out next time i come.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, nice, quiet location, very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: kungpao
Reviews.Content: EXTREMELY friendly staff, and very helpful in providing directions, reservations, bookings, and transportation assistance. Convenient location, within 3 small blocks of the Arasta Bazaar, and 5-7 minutes of the main square where the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia are located. The rooms are very clean, and quaintly decorated. They had nice little touches to make the room feel more homey. It was also nice that they had an elevator in their little hotel. Maps of the city are pretty atrocious, since it seems that no single map has all of the streets necessary, and there doesnâ€™t appear to be a standardized spelling for street names and places. The beds could have been a bit more comfortable, though, since you could feel the springs in the beds. Aside from that, the breakfasts are awesome with their homemade jams, yogurts, baked goods, teas/coffees.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Breort
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Istanbul! The location is outstanding - we walked practically everywhere we went. The owner, Ozen, was incredibly friendly and helpful (both before and during our stay), as was the entire staff. She has obviously spent a lot of time carefully selecting and nurturing the staff as they were all excellent! There is so much attention to detail for everything that a guest want. Complimentary bottled water supplied throughout our stay, along with a half bottle of Turkish wine, and the knowledge that, should you need anything else, you would just need to ask. Hakam and Burhan were always available to answer questions and book whatever tours we wanted. We really felt at home. This was our first city of a month long journey and my daughter kept talking about how great the breakfast was at Emine Sultan. The rooms were small, but very clean, pretty, and well-appointed. We were also allowed to stay in our rooms until 9PM on the day we checked out since the rooms hadn't been booked and our flight didn't leave until 11 PM. That was such a nice and welcome gesture on their part and saved us a lot of trouble. Thank you everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: fremex78
Reviews.Content: I choose the Emine Sultan Hotel based on the reviews here and I must say it was the right choice! Everyone in the hotel makes you feel like at home. The service is excellent, the rooms are cosy and nice, free water/Wifi, etc. And the location is really good: it is the best spot for nice restaurants and tourist attractions. And to go out clubbing or in the busy shopping area of the modern city you will be there in a short taxi ride. And the best is their terrace: with only 9 rooms you will never have many people on the terrace making it a very charming and romantic spot to drink the free half bottle of wine you got at your arrival. I would not hesitate one second if Iâ€™d go back to beautiful Istanbul and I would stay at the Emine Sultan Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “So lovely”
Reviews.Author: karenbellord
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here as our first hotel on our honeymoon in Turkey. We chose it because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor, especially because everyone said the staff were so kind and friendly, and they were right. From the moment we arrived to when we left everyone, especially the day manager Burhan, treated us very well. They were all friendly, helpful, discreet and not pushy and made our stay an absolute pleasure. When we arrived our room was upgraded which was wonderful. The things I will remember are; the amazing view of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace which blew us away, the kind staff, the lovely and very tasty breakfasts and the peace and tranquillity of the neighbourhood. The owner, Ã–zen, was so charming and helpful. Even when we returned to Istanbul and didn't stay there she still helped us. This hotel is a gem. Truly.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in old city”
Reviews.Author: Albey
Reviews.Content: Good location to the harbour but located in a quiet site which is only 5 mins to the bazzar area. Friendly host Ozen and she is helpful to give you best restaurant in town and place you have to visit. After you tried what she suggest It will make lonely planet useless. We got an extended to used our room (of course it is because the room was not booked by others) for free as our return flight is scheduled at 23:00.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: chillseoulja
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June as part of our honeymoon. Location is good, view from terrace is great, and the service here is amazing. Ozen, Hakkan (Burhan?), and Teddy Bear were all very friendly, but we dealt with Hakkan the most. He works the day shift, and on one of our nights, he worked 36 hours straight. But I don't see anyone here talking about him so maybe his name is Burhan, not sure. Anyway, Ozen also told us about a non-touristy hamam and when I asked her how much cash we should bring, she offered to lend us money. What kind of hotel does that? We've only stayed in big chain hotels such as Holiday Inn and Sheraton so this type of personal attention was very shocking (in a good way). Also, one of the mornings, we were sleeping past 10am when the front desk called us to remind us to have breakfast. That was a bit odd, but still speaks to the amount of personal attention you get here. And when we were leaving, we took a shuttle to the airport for 8 euros (4 per person), but we only had 50-euro bills. Teddy Bear did not have change and said it was okay, the hotel would not charge us. I gave him all I had - about 3-4 euros in coins, and a few US dollar bills. The only negative part (which isn't the fault of the hotel) was that the "non-touristy" hamam still treated us like tourists. Ozen told us to bring our own towel, shampoo, and slippers so that they can't charge us extra, and said we would spend 40 YTL/person, max. When we got there, however, we were only shown 2 options: 40 YTL for bath, 50 YTL for bath, massage, and tip. And the ride back that we were promised was a bit more harrowing, as the hamam employees expected us to walk back, when we had just arrived in Istanbul a few hours prior. After calling the hotel (hotel told us to call them if there was a problem), they put us in a taxi, which dropped us off near the Blue Mosque because I don't think the driver knew where the hotel was. But we had no idea where we were, and wandered around until we found a restaurant owner who was willing to call the hotel for us. A few minutes later, we saw Hakkan running towards us to get us. Now THAT'S SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Emine Sultan Hotel recently with two friends. The rooms were small but immaculately clean, each with a complimentary bottle of Turkish wine. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. They recommended a local Turkish Bath instead of the tourist ones, phoned ahead to book and arranged a free drop off and pick up for us. There is a breakfast room on the 4th floor with free tea and coffee available all day and a rooftop terrace which gives stunning views across the Bospherous. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in central Sultanahmet location”
Reviews.Author: KL_NF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two nights of our honeymoon and were really pleased that we had chosen to stay here. We had emailed Ozen (the owner) before we booked and had found her really helpful - she even rearranged room bookings so that we could have one of the best rooms -302, on the top floor with sea views - and made many suggestions for things to see and do in Istanbul. On arrival we were taken to our room and it was a really pleasant surprise to be offered a complimentary half bottle of wine (which as far as i am aware is offered to all guests, not just those on honeymoon!) and complimentary bottles of water in the minibar fridge. Throughout our stay all members of staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, for example letting us use their own computer when the internet on the laptop for hotel guests wasnt working, and booking us the best table in a nearby rooftop restaurant. It was also lovely to take our wine onto the roof terrace as the sun was going down and to eat the turkish delight that was there for guests to help themselves to as we looked out over the sea of marmara on one side and the blue mosque on the other. The location was excellent, just 10 minutes walk to the tram stop, or 5-10 minutes to the Blue Mosque. We weren't bothered by the noise from the mosque calls (but that might have been something to do with being on the side ofthe hotel facing the sea, and on the top floor). In summary, a great little hotel with personal service and a friendly welcoming atmosphere, we'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Letter of Introduction”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeHerbert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the sort of place one could have only found out about through Trip Advisor. The guide books are always, because of the time involved in printing, a least 18 months old, sometimes up to 3 years. I'll try to keep the review short and to the point. The owner, Ã–zen, who was mostly absent during our stay, is a charming host who has obviously worked hard with all her staff. They were polite, friendly, very helpful and completely unobtrusive (and we were on honeymoon and I'm English so that's saying something.) The hotel is very clean, very well located and, though one of the rooms we stayed in rooms was a bit small (we had one night on the fourth (top) floor and the rest in a larger room on the floor below after a free upgrade), all in all the physical hotel was very well appointed and had a great deal of attention to detail, especially considering its reasonable rates. We had a variety of standard travellers' problems (lack of currency, problem with our door's lock, etc) and all of these were sorted out with speed, good grace and humour - a very rare combination in any hotel. I was even lent a good 50 euros in Turkish Lira by the eminently charming, and helpful Burhan when I wanted to go off to a hamam. Their breakfasts are varied and delicious (and up to 10am but there's always plenty to snack on at all hours), the view from the breakfast room and roof terrace marvellous. All in all this place is like staying with friends of friends by way of a letter of introduction. I cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Jonass
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, especially concerning the owner and staff. Also good for those going to Istanbul for the first time, as it is close to most major tourist attractions. The only negative I found is that the room gets very bright early in the morning, as there were no blackout shades and the windows were plenty. Do not miss Balikci Sabahattin, very pleasant fish restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, liked location, loved roof patio”
Reviews.Author: MortUSA_Polska
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second part of my trip to Istanbul and loved this hotel. It is spotless and nicely decorated. The staff is only too happy to help with any request. There was a criticism of Ozen on this review which I must say is unfair. I met her once and she is very charming and helpful but please remember she has a life. She cannot be at the hotel at everyones beckon call, yet I can say with confidence Im sure she could be contacted 24/7 especially in emergencies with which I would feel very secure with her help suggestions. This is truly one of the finest hotels in Istanbul for the price. I liked its location, it is not right on Akbiyik Cad. which I like because actually there are 2 great restaurants a stones throw from the hotel, Buhara, and Doy Doy, much cheaper and better than what you get on Ak. Cad. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, with a really PERSONAL touch”
Reviews.Author: salmanc
Reviews.Content: What can i say, from the moment we got there, the service was absolutely excellent. It was like walking into your own home without any fuss, hassle. The people there are super friendly, including Ozen, the main hotel manager - she was great. and also Burhan, the day Manager who told us all about the local sites, things to do, quick ways to get to places and above all he was just an all round great guy. he also sat with us during breakfast and we got to know his flamboyant character! Erhan is the night manager and is also equally friendly, you can stand and chat for hours with these folks...The room was clean, tidy and so close to everything. 2 minute walk from the main square. You can't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy stay in old city”
Reviews.Author: apkav
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in mid-March 2009. Our room (and the entire place) was cosy and clean and the bed was large and comfortable. All staff were attentive, friendly and ready to help. The breakfast was good, with continental and Turkish touches. Fresh fruit, cereals, salads, cheeses, juices, coffee, tea and a choice of bread made up the selection. The room had good view to old city and sea, but the sunshading was poor, so there was much light every morning. Another problem was the small mosque just 100 meters away. During night, every some hours, there was too much noise from the praying imam. Difficult to continue your sleep without ear shields for about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, elegant and clean hotel - absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Amna_leeds
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an incredible week in istanbul, and it was made all the more memorable by the excellent experience at Emine Sultan Hotel. In a nutshel, it was incredibly clean, comfortable and the staff were so friendly, i feel like we'd known them for years! We couldnt have asked for a better location, a 5 mintute walk from the Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque and the hustle and bustle of Sultanahmet, it was ideal. The beds were comfortable and the rooms cleaned everyday, we recieved an exquisite breakfast on the roof terrace every morning which had breathtaking views of the Blue mosque and the Bosphorus. Overall, a beautiful hotel which we will no doubt visit again, and recommend to all our friends and family. Thank you to the manager, Ozen and all the staff :)

Reviews.Title: “A real turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: micky-v
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out onto the roof terrace and took in the breathtaking view of the Blue Mosque, it was clear we were going to love staying at the Emine Sultan. Having traded emails with Ozen before flying out to Istanbul we already had a shortlist of 'must see' sights but little did we expect to see dolphins out in the Bosphorus as we tucked into a great breakfast or to experience, at her recommendation, a traditional Turkish Bath at a local (and distinctly un-touristy) hamam. These are just some of the extras that make for a truly memorable short break and itâ€™s a real privilege to have enjoyed the hospitality at this hotel where nothing is too much trouble and guests are treated as good friends. Would we stay here again? You bet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: parislights
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Emine Sultan hotel at the end of May 2009. Our room (and the entire place) was cosy and spotlessly clean and the bed was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was quite small but the shower was powerful and again very clean. There was free water in the fridge and a list of things to do in Istanbul with a kind note from Ozen on the desk. All of the staff were attentive, friendly and ready to help us with any request we might have had. Ozen even bought us a little parting gift as we were celebrating a special event. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful, with continental and Turkish touches. Fresh fruit, cereals, salads, cheeses, juices, coffee, tea and a choice of bread made up the selection. The location of the hotel is a short 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque (with a great view of it from the upstairs terrace), and is close to many other sights. There is a tram stop just ten minutes away from the hotel which is convenient for lots of other places in the city. This is not a large multinational-owned hotel with spa or enormous rooms, it is a lovely, charming, family-owned place with exceptionally friendly staff. It deserves the good reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: hjtWindsor_England
Reviews.Content: I'll start at the end of our stay - as we climbed into our taxi and waved goodbye to the hotel staff and Ozen. the owner, I said to my husband that it was like leaving old friends. The hotel is a beautifully restored Ottoman townhouse in the old part of Istanbul and is within easy walking/transport links of all attractions. The hotel is clean and simply yet stylishly decorated and Ozen's practice of sleeping in each room to check the facilities, ensures that nothing has been overlooked. Furthermore, the guests are encouraged to use the terrace/breakfast room as their own home and delicious treats such as Turkish Delight and tea/coffee are available at all times of the day and night. The view from the breakfast room is fantastic and I can't think of a better way to start a day in Istanbul than looking out over the sea, eating a delicious breakfast in the Emine Sultan Hotel. Our room was compact but contained everything that we needed to make this a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do enough for you at this charming guest hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tornbush
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I, and both our mothers, stayed here in April for 3 nights. Must say that never has a hotel done so much to accommodate and genuinely help out to make your trip as enjoyable as possible. The owner, Ozen, along with staff, Burhan and Ali, were all incredibly helpful, friendly and welcoming. They helped us to find alternative accommodation when we wanted to stay longer but their hotel was booked out; they insisted my mother - despite then staying at another hotel - still come over for complimentary breakfast and free internet use; bought a cake and wine for my mother's birthday; gave insightful advice and answered our innumerable questions; booked restaurants; arranged taxis; drank and ate with us,etc.... As for the hotel itself, you can't find a cleaner, quainter and more comfortable hotel in all of Istanbul, regardless of price - trust me we looked. Spent hours and hours online before the trip trying to find a hotel that didn't look too dated, shabby, or gaudy...found the Emine Sultan which looked quite nice on the internet, and turned out to be nicer in reality. Out of so many over-priced for what you get hotels that there seem to be in Istanbul, Emine Sultan is a real gem of a bargain. Honestly priced with genuine hospitality, this hotel and its staff really helped to make our trip to Istanbul. Cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice; great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: charlesanderin
Reviews.Content: First of all, be advised the Emine is a small, intimate hotel without the amenities of a much larger hotel. Yes, the rooms are small (though my wife and I were upgraded during our 6 night stay from room 404 to room 202 which was much more spacious), but immaculately kept and should suffice for most tourists who spend most of their day sightseeing. Children may be more problematic in standard rooms, but there are larger rooms available. The staff, especially the day manager Burhan, were all very friendly and extremely helpful. The owner Ã–zen was present while we were there (May 2-8) and was very gracious. The service staff was great as well, though knowing a few phrases in Turkish helps considerably. Our experience seems largely to have mirrored the positive reviews on this site; it's not perfect (the beds are VERY FIRM), but in a city of 15 million that is becoming more expensive each year, our price of 85 euros a night was ridiculously reasonable considering the location and the attentive staff. If your preferences for a hotel require the amenities common to a chain, then stay in a chain. If you enjoy a more relaxed, personal experience, stay here. Good value, great location, friendly people. And it's clean. What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways”
Reviews.Author: PeterBDurham
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Emine Sultan. The hotel was immaculate and we could not have been better looked after by all the staff. We thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we came at a bad time”
Reviews.Author: Lawsandiego
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the great reviews in TripAdvisor. In line with previous comments, it is true that the location is great and the roof terrace is a wonderful place to have breakfast and afternoon tea. However, Uzen, the owner was only present briefly for 1 day--other than that the staff ran the hotel. The desk clerk we found to not be very forthright with us, and his English only seemed to lead to confusion. We complained about the odors from a drainpipe in our bathroom and nothing was done to alleviate the problem. We complained that the bathtub was not draining and it was not addressed. The room was so cramped that it was difficult to find a place to put our 2 bags. Last but not least the wireless, which was important to us was sporadic at best and completely stopped working the last 2 days of our stay. Maybe, if Uzen took more care to be present and oversee her business, these complaints could have been resolved.

Reviews.Title: “excellent small hotel in centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: marionsurrey
Reviews.Content: ermine sultan hotel istanbul We spent nine nights in this delightful hotel. It was spotlessly clean, with endless hot water and strong showers had very friendly staff and we could make tea or coffee or even sandwiches whenever we liked which was extremely useful as Istanbul is very expensive. It was in an amazing position right in the centre in a very quiet street with great views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus and had a little roof garden It was also extremely good value

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SenorTango
Reviews.Content: Emine Sultan ienjoys a great location, the hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. The roof-top patio overseas the sea of Mamre, the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. Ozen, the owner, and Borhan, at the front desk, are friendly and very helpful. They will arrange transfers to and from the airport, recommend restaurants, make phone calls, and even book another hotel for you. Just minutes from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque Aya Sofia, shops and restaurants. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in excellent location with friendly, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: CarolG302
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise too highly the Emine Sultan Hotel. The location is perfect, our room (302) had superb sea views, was cleaned daily and we were supplied with fresh towels every day. The breakfasts were plentiful, delicious and very well prepared. As for the staff - they were friendly, helpful and professional. Their attention to detail was very impressive - we even received goodbye gifts. Thank you Ozen and staff - you made our stay in Istanbul unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: greycott
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Emine for 5 nights and found as other reviewers have said that the hotel is in a great location very near to the Blue Mosque and the other major attractions. The area around is quite shabby but I think you could get that in a lot of areas in Istanbul. The room was small but very nice and a view of the blue mosque. Wonderful views from the terrace. Ozen and her staff were all very helpful without being in your face. We had a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival and water in the fridge every day which was a nice touch. The only thing we didn't like about Istanbul was the constant harassment for you to go to their carpet shop etc. We have been to Turkey several times before so did know to expect this but did find it much more annoying in Istanbul. Also choose your restaurant with care as we only had 2 good meals out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Arguably the greatest hotel experience we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: For non-residents of Turkey, I can't imagine a better place to stay. If you have read the other reviews, you know about Ozen, who runs the hotel with unbelievable passion and charming personality. This is the real deal -- authentic and sincere in every way. This is not the Four Seasons Lite. If you want a ritzy and secluded enclave w/ all the trimmings of a resort, I can't say Emine Sultan is for you. That being said, their 10 rooms are beautifully appointed, and ours overlooked the Sea of Marmara, w/ mosque minarets in the foreground. The Blue Mosque is a stone's throw from the hotel and hovers over it in the coolest way. In general, hard to beat the location if you're interested in seeing Istanbul's many sights. But back to the main attraction -- Ozen and her supporting players. My wife (we were on our honeymoon) and I had come from Santorini and Crete in Greece, and despite how amazing that was, as we flew home, we couldn't stop talking about our new friends in Istanbul. Sitting in the lobby of the hotel is as fun/relaxing/entertaining as anything else in Turkey. Burhan and Erhan ("Teddy Bear") took outrageous steps to show us the city and explain things to us. They are truly special people, and I almost hesitate to describe all that they did for us, for fear of overpromising the same services to other guests. Based on the other reviews, however, I'd say you're in for a similar treat. "Highly recommended" does not adequately summarize my endorsement of this place. Go. Now. Charlie

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and charming!”
Reviews.Author: Shady-Grove
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 boys, ages 6 & 9) stayed here for 3 nights in the middle of a 2-month trip through Europe and the Middle East. We have never experienced a friendlier, more hospitable staff. While many hotels have employees who are trained to be perfectly polite and helpful, the folks at the Emine Sultan just exude a genuine warmth that was so refreshing and welcoming. The room was charming and the roof deck terrific. The location was great and we walked just about everywhere. What a vibrant city! Doy-Doy restaurant down the street was our favorite in the neighborhood. We will certainly come back--hopefully soon! Thank you Ozen!

Reviews.Title: “Homey, cozy, clean, great location, good price, friendly and dynamic staff, do you need more”
Reviews.Author: AngelGracie
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t have words enough to describe this amazing trip I did to Turkey, such mix of history and modern, mystery and colors, friendly people, great food amazing cities, great beaches, fun night clubs and restaurants, high class shopping malls, wonderful roads across the country, very safety, I rented a car and traveled all over by my self and never felt insecurity, Istanbul is a very cosmopolitan city without lose the 4.000 years of history! The perfect balance! One of the 10 places U must go before die! I need to say tank you 10.000 times for the amazing people from â€œEMINOU SULTAN HOTELâ€� who make me feel so homey and welcome, helping me in all my needs, giving me all directions and right tips for this blessed time, besides the great location, the hotel is new and very clean, delicious breakfast, from janitor , passing to desk people, to manager and owners, all are nice, polities and very helpful. Special thanks to OZEN. everything was sooooo good, sooo amazing , I had stretched my trip for more 1 month!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, bit cramped”
Reviews.Author: papa-rupe
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel on the basis of TA reviews. Really friendly owner & staff, great location right round the corner from the main Istanbul attractions so you can walk to everywhere. Only 10 rooms and ours was on the 'compact' size; basically, don't try to both move round the bed at once. As a result, can be a bit noisy, especially when the people in the room next door come back at 3am. Great views from the terrace; good breakfasts, good value. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Welcome and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Ritchy_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent 7 nights in the hotel, the booking was made because of the excellent comments in tripadvisor. I can fully confirm the comments: The hotel is new, furniture of a very good style, very clean and above all, the owner oezen and her staff members are absolutely friendly and give help whenever we asked for. Our son, who is currently as a student in Istanbul, have joined us occasionally for breakfast - no extra charge I've never seen a hotel with this high level of hospitality. The only disadvantage for us was that the nights were disrupted by the "Call for Prayer", litter service, street workers and others (But I guess this is typical for the Sultanahmet area)

Reviews.Title: “Surpassing all expectations - what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: 2muchfun4us
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay. The charm and location is great. From the time we walked in the door to the time we left we felt welcomed. Breakfast ist typical for Istanbul and gave us an insight about local customs. The staff was great and truly helpful in every way. The location in walking distance to all major attractions and restaurants yet quiet. Ozen treated us like family and most of the staff speaks english. Computer access is free. Front desk was most helpful in setting up tours and help with information. The elevator takes you to the breakfast room with a great view but the best view is on the roof garden. It is magical. It is a stunning view. Thanks, Ozen and staff!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Come with reasonable expectations and you'll be happy!”
Reviews.Author: SCH59
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here last week for a total of five nights (interrupted by our trip to Cappadokya). We had two rooms. Overall, we had a good stay. This is a small hotel (only 10 rooms), so don't expect all the facilities of a big hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are small but perfectly adequate unless you are travelling with a lot of baggage. The rooms are clean and basic, and the toiletries in the bathroom are also basic (not exclusive brands). Bottles of water in the â€œmini-barâ€� are free of chargeâ€¦although this was not made clear. The biggest plus of this hotel is the friendliness of the staff, especially Bulhan at the reception. He was also very helpful in ordering taxis, giving directions to the driver and to us, and as a general source of information. All staff members smile a lot, which puts you in a good mood. When you are taking a normal yellow taxi to the hotel, make sure you get proper directions written down â€“ or show the location on a map to the driver. The locality is a bit ragged, but clean and safe. It is not swanky, but we liked it this way â€“ best way to see the real Istanbul. Breakfast is fineâ€¦again, so long as you donâ€™t expect a large buffet. The staff are happy to provide cooked eggs, freshly squeezed OJ and Turkish coffee â€“ all free â€“ and all you have to do is ask! There was also a different Turkish dish like a cake or a grilled cheese gozleme or a borek everyday. We are vegetarian family, and our teenage kids did not go hungry! Wireless internet in the rooms is free but the connection is unsecured. The main computer in the lobby is also free and is secured. We had no problems with getting online. The trick is to come with reasonable and realistic expectations - and you should come away pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: michelledanielrobert
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Istanbul, where we stayed at the Emine Sultan Hotel. As the majority of reviews confirm, the owner, Ozen, went out of her way to make all her guests feel at home. The atmosphere in the hotel was very warm and friendly and the staff were all very helpful. The rooms were cleaned daily and everything was spotless. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of the historical quarter and plenty of restaurants and cafes. Guests are welcome to go and use the roof terrace at any time of the day and make themselves a tea or coffee, which was very welcome at the end of a day's sightseeing, before heading out again for dinner! A small problem we had with our light and toilet when we arrived were both sorted out the following morning, so no complaints. Breakfast was a buffet with a range of local cheeses, breads and fruit, as well as delicious cheese pancakes and home made cake. If you are looking for a small and relaxed hotel, that is a home from home, then this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Frederick_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Emine Sultan Hotel for five nights in March 2009, and like some other reviewers here, I feel as if the hotel where I stayed is not the one getting rave reviews here. I'm guessing that the reason we had only a so-so experience at this hotel is because while we were there, the owner, Ozen was absent. Perhaps the staff needs her presence to keep up standards. The hotel is in a very good location, only a few minutes walk to many major attractions. Be warned that many taxi drivers do not know where this hotel is located, so plan on walking. If you do have to take a taxi in Istanbul, be resigned to the fact that you will be cheated one way or another, and don't fall for the common scam where you give the driver a large note for payment, such as 50 lira, and he hides it or drops it on the floor and insists that you only gave him a 5 lira note. Get out of the cab before paying and make sure the driver acknowledges how much you are paying before giving him the fare. When we were shown to our room, the staff gave us no information about anything (such as how to use the safe in the closet or information about local attractions) except for the breakfast hours. Our room had 2 twin beds, which were hard as rocks. There was no top sheet on the bed, just a very heavy and lumpy comforter covered with a duvet. We had a view of the Bosphorus from our windows. Unfortunately, the windows aren't sealed very well, and not only let in cold air, but also smoke from the fireplaces of nearby houses and a lot of street noise. We could also clearly hear guests checking in next door in the early morning hours as well as the conversations they had in their room. Bring ear plugs. The bath was small, but adequate. We were served nothing like the breakfasts raved about in many reviews here - certainly no fresh pastries or cakes, and nothing like the photos on the hotel's web site. Just a basket of bread slices (no toaster), cold cereal, and assorted meats and cheeses which appeared to be the same trays set out all week. Coffee (very weak), tea, 2 juices and milk were also available. The woman working in the breakfast room was very nice, but did not speak English. Some of the staff had limited or no English skills as well. On our last night, the glass soap dish over the sink just fell off the wall, shattering into many pieces on the floor. I went down to the desk to ask for a clean up and the desk clerk could not understand what I needed. The free WIFI was nice, but it didn't always work properly. Overall, this hotel was just average and certainly not anything which deserves a 5 star review. I would stay elsewhere in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MissDurian
Reviews.Content: My experience here has been positive. On various different aspects of the hotel: Cleanliness - it is extremely clean. I simply cannot believe reviews that say that the hotel is dirty. It makes no sense for the management to clean one room or most of the rooms but not all of them. Location - good. It's a five to ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque and add another couple of minutes for the Sultanahmet tram station. Part of the way is uphill. The area behind the Blue Mosque is residential, as is much of Istanbul. There will be locals around and children playing in the streets - indeed, isn't that part of the charm? Cats - Cats are very popular in Muslim culture (and dogs are considered not so good). You will see lots of cats and they do mate every now and then, as do humans. It is, at least so far, the only way of keeping the species going. Breakfast - Tea, coffee (in pot, not Turkish), eggs, bread, cake, fruit conserve, honeycomb, yoghurt, butter, sliced meat, sausages, olives, various cheeses, cornflakes, Turkish delights, fruit, tomato, cucumber, omelette and freshly squeezed juice (both if you ask), non-fresh juices. That's about all I remember for now. Produce is fresh. It is a sufficient breakfast but if you expect a feast you may be disappointed. Prayer calls - it is part of the experience of travelling in another country with another dominant religion. The experience, even if it's being woken up at 5am, is culturally enriching. Travelling is more than "doing" the sites, taking the pictures so that you can say "been there, done that" to your jealous friends. So if tourists are to be disturbed by prayer calls, rethink destination - one is likely to have the same problem wherever one stays in a Muslim country. Staff - Ozen sat down and had coffee with me and helped me plan my first couple of days, which was nice of her as I didn't do my homework. Whether she can do that for everyone I know not, but I think she tries. Bottom line - I don't travel just to make friends with hotel staff, so as long as they are reasonably helpful and nice then that is enough for me. Staff here definitely passed this test. Noise - didn't really notice the traffic but sometimes tour buses do pass through on the next street. Hotel itself is built in wood so it will be more noisy. View - spectacular. Blinds - not so good as don't block out the sun. Shower - excellent. If problems identified by earlier travellers did indeed exist (e.g. no explanations about the mini-bar, telephone service) the management has made an effort to correct them. When shown to my room I was given an explanation of how everything worked, phone, aircon, and that the bottles of water were free.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: greengrassgirly
Reviews.Content: By far the best service we've had at any hotel ever. Thanks so much Ozen and team for taking such good care of us. They organized rides for us to places we wanted to go, they offered to get us drinks while we were in the lobby, they brought a shop keeper in who brought his goods that we had specifically asked to know more about. Ozen offered us everything and anything that would make our trip more comfortable. They also have amazing fresh squeezed orange juice and the staff up in the breakfast room is amazing kind. Rooms are small but very Cozy! I really loved this hotel. It was a great choice. Oh, and there is a call of prayer heard at 5 am from a nearby mosque. Really normal in the Muslim world. Get prepared for that because no matter where you stay, you will most likely hear it. THanks so much Ozen

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed hospitality, better than a 5-star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: World_Travellers2526
Reviews.Content: The Emine Sultan is by far the best hotel that my wife and I have had the pleasure of staying at. Our stay was for 6 nights. We have stayed at many hotels throughout Europe, U.K., and North AmerÄ±ca and have never experienced such incredible hospitality. The manager, Ã–zen, and her staff made us feel at home from the moment we arrived. During out first breakfast, she sat down with us over Turkish coffee and made a list of sites for us to see, givÄ±ng us a lot of excellent tips. When we told her that we had to change our flight back from Cappodoccia, she actually got on the phone with the airline for us and changed it. I can't understand the reviewers who complained about the service here. All of the staff were incredibly helpful -- all you had to do was ask for help and they would go out of their way to make sure you got what you wanted. The room we had (202) was nicely appointed and very comfortable. There was a nice new flatscreen t.v mounted on the wall. Our double bed was comfortable and there was even an extra daybed that we used as a couch. The bathroom was very clean and our towels were changed daÄ±ly. Great water pressure Ä±n the shower (and no shortage of hot water!). There was always a bottle or two of free water in the minifridge everyday. They were replaced as we used them. The comlimentary breakfast each morning was excellent. Freshly squeezed orange juice, Turkish tea, coffee, with a wide assortment of cheeses, bread, fresh fruit and cakes. If you ask, you can even have a delicious omelette made. The hotel's location couldn't be better. It is a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, and the Arasta Bazaar. There are lots of excellent retaurants and cafes nearby as well. The tram is a short walk away and quite easy to get to, and the hotel will even give you a complimentary transit pass (called Akbil) that can be used on all public transit in the city. While you will hear the call to prayer from the neÄ±ghbouring mosques, you will hear it all over Turkey (it is a Muslim country!). We are light sleepers and after the first morning it didn't wake us up. Anyway, we thought it was a charming and beautÄ±ful part of the experience. There Ä±s a laptop Ä±n the lobby with free high speed internet service. We used it everyday! Overall we had a perfect experience in this new, very clean and hospitable hotel! We highly recommend staying here and wÄ±ll boast about this place to all our frÄ±ends and family back home! We couldn't wait to write this review (today is our last day here) ... we actually feel a bit sad about leaviÄ±ng. We have 3 more countries and 9 more hotels that we will be staying at ... we can only hope that they can live up to the comfort and service that we experienced here! We wÄ±ll greatly miss Ã–zen, Burhan, Ali, Alice, Zeki and Erhan. The kind and helpful breakfast staff (Kadria and Fatima) who always had a smile on their face and tried very hard with their English will be missed too! They all made us feel like family!

Reviews.Title: “perfect service and location”
Reviews.Author: FranWilson
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Emine Sultan could not have been better. We arrived early and were greeted by super friendly staff, especially Burhan! Our room was not ready (it was 10am!) but they gave us free tea and coffee on the roof top terrace with a spectacular view over the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea. They also chatted with us for the 15-20minutes until the room was ready. When we got to the room, we found we had a stunning view of the Blue Mosque and they had left a couple of small bottles of wine on our bed as a greeting gift. I am not sure if this is standard practice or something special because I had said it was my partner's birthday, either way it was a very sweet gesture. The location was perfect - walking distance to all the major tourist sites in the old city, but in a quiet side street where you felt like you are living amongst the locals. The staff always offered helpful suggestions and were pleased to help us in any way possible - always with a smile! There was free internet downstairs and wireless in the room. While the breakfast was simple in comparison to large chain standards, it was all delicious and had everything you needed - and that view from the breakfast room was simply stunning! We had the rooftop terrace to ourselves to watch the sun go down over the sea and to see the blue mosque bathed in the changing lights. With the free wine, it was just perfect! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. Our poor friends chose to stay somewhere else and were always jealous of our chosen accommodation. If you are thinking about booking here, and want a small, friendly place in the middle of the old city, then just do it! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It ticked all the boxes for us, unusual in this day & age.”
Reviews.Author: RogerTBear
Reviews.Content: To stay at a family run hotel & be treated like one of the family was an honour & a privelige. All the staff were so kind & friendly. It felt as though we were staying with relatives !!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tapetenwechsler
Reviews.Content: Owner Ã–zem and her team really make you feel welcome in this little family-run hotel. The Emine Sultan is located very conveniently in a small side street, only a short walk away from major sights (e.g. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace) as well as from the metro/tram that takes you to KarakÃ¶y/Beyoglu and the airport. The rooms are modern, cosy and very clean, the breakfast buffet offers a good variety of choices (I especially liked the delicious jams), and almost every day a different home-made delicacy, which you can enjoy at the same time as the great view. The only small downside we could find was that - in addition to the inevitable call of the Muezzin - light sleepers may hear a little bit of "neighbourhood noise" such as the garbage being picked up in the morning, but we assume that this would also be the case in most other hotels. All in all, we believe the Emine Sultan is very good value for money and can really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “looking for a fammily in a city of 15 million?”
Reviews.Author: dusanu
Reviews.Content: You found it. Ã–zen and her team / family (and I mean everybody!!!) made sure that we felt like at home in this small, but tastefully decorated hotel. The location is great if you want to spend time in Sultanahmet, but also well connected with tram. The service is great, but you should not forget to ask if you need something - they will really make sure you have everything you need! And most of all, the human touch and a ready advice at ANY time of the day or night. I know where I am spending my next trip to Istanbul and I am recomending it to everybody I know. Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: sakura_65
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day break at this hotel and we all agreed that it was the best decision to make! The hotel is located in central Istanbul and therefore very close to the main sights. It is definitely a great choice if you want to stay in a very comfortable and clean hotel that offers excellent service and good breakfast. The rooms are very well equipped and have a wonderful view. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Especially Ã–zen is very lovely and never getting tired of giving useful tips. I'd definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to a time when we will go back.”
Reviews.Author: JLEngland
Reviews.Content: 17.02.2009 Wonderful hotel, brilliantly clean, great location and incredibly friendly and helpful staff, what more could you wish for? and oh yes, the views from the breakfast room are fabulous and the breakfast itself is a meal of so many choices you could spend all day trying to tackle it! Not often we say this, but we will go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: jappy11
Reviews.Content: Room comfortable and clean. No tea/ coffee making facilites in room, which for the Â£105 per night that we paid you would expect. Breakfast was rather poor, View from breakfast room was superb. Staff were helpful. For the price rather disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly family run hotel, great value for 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadeeyes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights, and we were delighted with this charming small family run hotel. I feel that it was great value and service for a 3 star hotel, which is why I've rated it so highly. The room was small, but very cosy feeling, with a great view. The only downside is that the windows were quite thin and didn't offer great soundproofing, and we were woken up at 5 every morning for the morning call to prayer, but considering the amount of mosques in the city I'm not sure you could get away from it in any hotel. Breakfast was nice, it had many cheeses to try, olives, cereals, bread and boiled egg. Ozen (one of the owners) mother made us turkish coffee to try, which was quite nice! Ozen and her father run the hotel, and they are both very friendly and informative! I feel that their presence adds to the charm of this small hotel. It's in a great location, about 5 minutes from the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, and about a 25 minute drive from the airport in light traffic. Also, they have free internet acess in the reception. If I went to Istanbul again, I would definetly go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, But be wary of all the gushing reviews”
Reviews.Author: spank_inferno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 2 night stay in the Emine Sultan where we had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is located amongst some narrow streets in the heart of the Sultanamat district of the city. It is in residential area with a few kids (and many cats) about. The hotel is a small 4 storey building. Just inside the entrance there is a courtesy laptop for going online with a pretty good connection speed. The staff were very nice. Ozan is a lovely woman and alongside her brother and father they run the place. The rooms are nice, nothing fancy & quite clean. Bathrooms are also good, with hot water available and good shower preassure.. As a previous reviewer mentioned, The mini bar situation was never explained so we didnt use it. The room had 20inch flat screen with about 60 channels. Unfortunately the only english language ones are BBC news, BBC Prime & CNN. Breakfast: Modest fare it has to be said. There is quite limited choice but the house keeper did make us a turkish coffee which was nice of her. The stay: As mentioned, though in the heart of the old city, this area is a warren of small residential streets. The hotel has very poor noise insulation. So be warned if you are a light sleeper. I was woken on the first night by some neighbourhood cats "expressing their intimacy" outside. Traffic noise was also very noticable. The floors are wooden also so there isnt a lot of internal sound insulation either. Considering its very close proximity to the sights of instanbul I would still consider this hotel good value. Other reviewers throw the "5-dots" review like confetti, but I want to give as rounded review as possible. The staff are lovely and helpfull but the hotel has its weakpoints as I mentioned above. Therefore though competent it cannot be considered a top hotel. Personally we loved our stay, But I can see where some guests might feel dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “O.k., but doesn't live up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: gracie-boo
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest. I really wanted to love the Emine Sultan, but I just didnâ€™t. I usually rely on Tripadvisor reviews when visiting a new city, and I carefully read through the Istanbul Hotel recommendations, and emailed several hotels before choosing the Emine Sultan. I liked the tone of the owner/manager, Ozenâ€™s emails; she sounded friendly and extremely helpful, so we chose the Emine Sultan on that basis. We took a prearranged shuttle from the airport to the hotel (20 Euros), and check-in was efficient and easy. There are narrow stairs you may use to get to your room, or the hotel has a very small elevator. We had room 203, which did have a view of the Bosporus, over the rooftops. The room was very clean, with two twin beds, a flat screen TV, wardrobe and small table. I was very impressed with the water pressure in the shower; it was great, and there was always plenty of hot water. There was a small refrigerator under the TV; it was filled with soft drinks, beer and water, but I have no idea how the mini bar worked, as this was never explained to us. We just bought our water elsewhere and stored it in the refrigerator. We were not given any information about the hotel by the staff at the desk, except that breakfast would be served between the hours of 8-10. No one told us where the guest accessible computer was located (itâ€™s in the lobby, where many times, the desk clerk was using it), and I did not even know there was a rooftop terrace, until we accidentally stumbled onto it the last day of our stay. We never saw the owner/manager, Ozen, our entire visit. I am not sure where she was. It does seem to me though, that perhaps many of the Emine Sultanâ€™s glowing reviews have something to do with her personality/helpfulness, etc., and not with the hotel itself. I did not ask for help with any sort of plans, such as dining recommendations, tours, etc. from the front desk, so I cannot comment upon the staffâ€™s helpfulness. They did offer the use of an umbrella when it was raining, but we had brought our own. In reading other reviews of the Emine Sultanâ€™s breakfast offerings, I am wondering if we stayed at the same place. We did not ever see any cake or cookies or any other pastries offered at breakfast. For the first five mornings we were there, there was an orange flavored loaf bread which is the only pastry type food I saw. There was always a counter with three types of juices and most times a container of milk. Coffee, hot water and tea were also provided. There is tip box on the drink counter. Sometimes, there was also a bowl of fruit, such as apples. Another counter always had an assortment of cheeses, which looked increasingly weary as the week went on, olives, a couple different types of sliced meats, tomatoes, cucumbers, sliced French type bread, and some green peppers which were never touched. Jams and usually butter were also prprovided. I was very, very tired of the same offerings by the sixth day, and even though I am not usually a breakfast eater, longed for a toaster and some bread. The location is good and we walked everywhere in Sultanhamet, and never took the public transportation. Just had one very unpleasant experience with a taxi; highly recommend you avoid them at all costs, unless you are well versed on all the very many ways they can try to scam you. I advise you to bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper; the street outside has trucks going by with slamming doors and loud noises all night long. I am a very heavy sleeper, and it even bothered me. One night, I was awakened at 1:00 am, by the arrival of some new guests in the room next door. Even the hotel staff who accompanied them to their room, stood outside talking very loudly in the hallway for at least 15 minutes. Very inconsiderate. I never knew how to phone the front desk, but I did email the hotel using my phone to complain about the noise, but I never received any response. A note about the WIFI coverage; during our stay, it was very erratic, and often times would not be accessible for hours at a time. After these guests checked in, I could hear everything through the walls of their room. Unfortunately, they were night owls who liked to bang around and watch TV until the wee hours of the morning. Payback came the next morning as the call to prayer at 6:15 am woke them up. You will be able to hear this call from at least three different mosques, so if this bothers you, again, bring ear plugs. Check out was again efficient, but the desk clerk seemed confused as to what our room cost, and had to call someone to find out what the rate was (85 Euro per night). He was able to split the charge so we each paid half, which was helpful and convenient for us. The Emine Sultan was not a bad place to stay; the location was convenient and the rooms clean. I guess just expected more from reading all the over-the-top reviews and feel somewhat disappointed. Would I stay here again if I went back to Istanbul? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSalesman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice during our Turkey visit and the staff was wonderful. Extremely friendly and helpful. The location is perfect with views of the Blue Mosque and the water. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: wrocki
Reviews.Content: Great location very close to the Blue Mosque. The neighbourhood is quiet but there are good restaurants (e.g. Buhara 93) and interesting shops nearby. We booked (including airport pickup) by e-mail with Ã–zen the owner/manager and she and all her staff went out of their way to welcome us and ensure we had a good stay. The service is both friendly and unobtrusive; they do not push any tours etc on you but if you ask them to recommend a restaurant they are happy to do so and we found their advice to be good. The hotel is recently renovated and our double room (202) was spotlessly clean and exactly as shown on the hotels website (including the view of the Bosphorus). It was also big enough to accommodate the extra bed for our eight year old (at no extra charge) without being particularly cramped. There is free WLAN access throughout the hotel and a computer for guest use located in reception. We paid 70 Euros a night and while larger, more expensive hotels may match or exceed the facilities and location they are unlikely to be as accommodating or easy to deal with as the Emine Sultan. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: ligural
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emine Sultan thanks to Suleyman Cakir, from Capadocia Tours who organized all our services in Turkey and suggested the hotels. Great choice! - It is around the corner of all the important sites in Sultanahmet and if you want to go to the modern part of the city you just take the tramway also "around the corner"... Great view, tiny spotless clean rooms. Buffet breakfast with homemade marmalades is absolutely delicious. I would stay there again without any doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: antmusic
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Emine Sultan Hotel. The room and bath room were attractive and spotless. The staff were helpful. Breakfast was fresh and plentyful I would reccommend booking the shuttlebus from the airport for hassel free transfers I would definatly stay at the Emne Sultan next time i am in Istanbul The slippers provided by the hotel were a nice touch

HotelInfo.Name: Emine Sultan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ayasofya Caddesi | Kapi Agasi Sok. No: 6 Sultanahmet, Istanbul, Turkey
